0.title: IIT Kanpur student found dead in hostel room
0.article_body: A PhD student of IIT Kanpur, Prasant Singh, was found dead inside his hostel room on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a hostel resident informed the security that Singh's room was locked from inside and there was no response to knocks. When the institute's administration forced the door open, he was found hanging from the ceiling.

1.title: Russia hasn't lost anything over its military campaign in Ukraine: Putin
1.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Russia hasn't "lost anything" over its military campaign in Ukraine. "In terms of what we've gained, I can say that the main gain has been...strengthening of our sovereignty," he added. However, Putin admitted that Russia's decision to send troops into Ukraine had created a "certain polarisation, both in the world and within the country".

2.title: Nasdaq top exec to meet FM to discuss listing of Indian firms in US
2.article_body: Nasdaq Executive Vice-Chairman Edward Knight said that he will meet Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss the listing of Indian companies in the US. "India should allow initial listing of companies on US stock exchanges," said Knight. He added that India has 260 unicorns ready to go public and that he would like to set up a startup-to-unicorn pipeline.

3.title: Video shows elderly woman selling snacks on Mumbai local; social media users offer help
3.article_body: A video showing an elderly woman selling snacks on a Mumbai local train has gone viral. Social media users praised the elderly woman and enquired for her contact details to extend help. The video was shared by Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, who wrote, "This woman and thousands of people like her work hard to earn bread."

4.title: BESCOM received over 32,000 distress calls between Sept 4-5
4.article_body: More than 32,000 power outage complaints were received between Sunday and Monday (September 4-5) as there was an electricity shut down in several apartments and societies in Bengaluru due to heavy rainfall, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said. The power supply was suspended in these apartments and localities as a precautionary measure to avoid short-circuit incidents.

5.title: 'Brahmastra' sells over 1.30 lakh tickets despite boycott trend on Twitter
5.article_body: Amid the boycott trend on Twitter and protests against the film 'Brahmastra', the film managed to sell 1.31 lakh tickets at the national chains through advance booking for the opening day till September 7. As per Pinkvilla, the three national chains have sold over 2.50 lakh tickets for the movie for the opening weekend. 'Brahmastra' will feature Ranbir Kapoor.

6.title: Those who divided India now talking about 'Bharat jodo': BJP spokesperson
6.article_body: Commenting on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla said that Congress has only done 'Bharat todo'. "Rahul Gandhi and First Family have always believed in undermining Sardar Patel and never celebrated his efforts…From 1947 to now…Those who divided India are now talking about 'Bharat jodo'," Poonawalla tweeted. "This is 'bhrashtachar jodo' not 'Bharat jodo'," he added.

7.title: India means opportunities, entire 21st century is India's: Goyal
7.article_body: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that India meant "opportunities" and it is not just this decade but the entire 21st century belongs to India. He was interacting with the faculty and students of the Stanford Graduate School of Business in San Francisco. Goyal is on a six-day visit to the US for various programmes.

8.title: French lawmakers visit Taiwan as tensions with China escalate
8.article_body: A delegation of five French lawmakers, led by Senator Cyril Pellevat, arrived in Taiwan on Wednesday. The lawmakers will meet high-ranking officials, including Taiwan's Vice President Lai Ching-te and Legislative Speaker You Si-Kun, to discuss security and innovation. This is first high-level European delegation to visit Taiwan since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited despite China's warnings.

9.title: India's plan to shift to renewables has received a jolt: Sitharaman
9.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's plans for transition to renewables have received a jolt. Addressing the US-India Business Council summit, Sitharaman said, "There are huge uncertainties over availability of crude, natural gas and coal due to the (Russia-Ukraine) war" because of which many nations, including India, are mulling going back to coal to meet their energy needs.

10.title: Dinesh Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room: Sehwag
10.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has questioned Deepak Hooda's inclusion in Team India's XI ahead of Dinesh Karthik in their Asia Cup Super 4 matches against Pakistan and Sri Lanka. "I can't understand the logic of Hooda's selection...Karthik can't finish games by sitting in the dressing room," stated Sehwag. Hooda didn't bowl in both the matches and scored 16 and 3.

11.title: Promoter says Bieber's India concert to go ahead as planned amid his break
11.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber announced he will be taking a break from performances across the world to put his health first. Earlier, Bieber had revealed he was suffering from Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. However, one of the promoters of Bieber's India concert stated the Asia leg of the Justice Tour, which includes his show in India in October, will continue as scheduled.

12.title: Suspect in Canada stabbing case had 59 criminal convictions: Documents
12.article_body: Myles Sanderson, an alleged attacker involved in killing 10 people in Canada, has 59 criminal convictions, parole documents said. Sanderson had been serving a sentence of four years and four months on charges including assault with a weapon. Public Safety Minister Marco Mendicino said that many of Sanderson’s past crimes happened when he was intoxicated.

13.title: Congress' politics confined to attacking PM, Centre: Maha minister
13.article_body: Maharashtra Revenue Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Wednesday said Congress party's politics revolved around attacking the Centre while keeping larger party-related and public issues on the back-burner. "To retain its identity, it has to show it is doing something. So, the easiest thing to draw attention is to attack the Prime Minister Narendra Modi government," Patil added.

14.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 2% amid reports of multiple block deals
14.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares opened 2% lower after reports of multiple block deals of 1.09% stake. Nearly 10.4 crore shares worth ₹7,906 crore changed hands at ₹750 apiece. Reuters had reported in August that Singapore Telecommunications would sell a 3.3% stake in Airtel to Bharti Telecom in the next three months. At 12 pm, Airtel was trading at ₹746.60 on BSE.

15.title: After Ranbir-Alia denied temple entry, MP posts celebs' pic with PM, says 'it won't help'
15.article_body: After Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were reportedly stopped from entering into Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar temple by Bajrang Dal, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi posted a photo of Bollywood celebrities with PM Narendra Modi. Chaturvedi wrote, "None of this photo op will help if you'll continue to be mute spectators to hate & believe it's not your business to talk politics."

16.title: Tejashwi Yadav makes surprise visit to govt hospitals in Patna, video surfaces
16.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday night made a surprise visit to Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH), New Gardiner Road Hospital and Gardanibagh Hospital. "The condition of PMCH's Tata ward is getting worse," Tejashwi, who is also the state Health Minister, said. "There were no medicine arrangements...patients were not being provided facilities...negligence was seen," he stated.

17.title: Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj': Lekhi on renaming Rajpath to 'Kartavya Path'
17.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi said that name of Rajpath has been changed to 'Kartavya Path' because Rajpath conveys you've come for 'Raj'. "We carried forward colonial mindset after Independence...PM said that country is celebrating 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' and we've to end imperialistic policies, symbols. So, the name of Rajpath has been changed," the BJP leader said.

18.title: US actress Megan Hilty's sister, brother-in-law and their kid die in seaplane crash
18.article_body: US actress Megan Hilty's sister Lauren Hilty, brother-in-law Ross Mickel, and their child Remy were among the 10 people who died in a seaplane crash in Mutiny Bay on Sunday. Lauren was pregnant with a baby boy, who was going to be named Luca, according to TMZ. It is currently unknown what caused the crash.

19.title: No sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III: Musk's leaked text
19.article_body: Amid their lawsuit, Twitter's lawyer revealed a text sent by Tesla CEO Elon Musk to a banker, alleging that Musk was looking for a way out of the deal and that his claims on spam accounts were merely a pretext to end it. The message read, "It won't make sense to buy Twitter if we're heading into World War III."

20.title: Fire breaks out at showroom in Guwahati; cars, bikes worth ₹1.5 cr burnt
20.article_body: A fire broke out at a Benelli and Isuzu showroom in Assam's Guwahati. Isuzu cars worth at least ₹1.5 crore were burnt and Benelli bikes worth ₹6-7 lakh were burnt, a showroom employee said. "Totalling with the property loss, we hit a ₹4-5 crore loss," the employee added. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the site.

21.title: Govt staff to get salary today, no lack of funds: Punjab minister
21.article_body: Asserting that there is no shortage of funds, Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema on Wednesday said that state government's employees will get their salaries by evening. "[The] Punjab government made 9,000 contractual employees permanent, due to which the process of giving out salaries…got delayed by three-four days," said Cheema. He added that 18,000 new recruitments have been done.

22.title: He's boyish, immature: Jairam over Assam CM's remark on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
22.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's "Congress should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan" remark, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, "He's a recent migrant to BJP, so he has to make outrageous statements every day." He added, "I don't take Assam CM seriously...I think Assam CM is boyish, immature...makes statements only to prove his loyalty to his new masters."

23.title: Pune's Yerawada, Kothrud reported highest noise level this Ganeshotsav: MPCB
23.article_body: Pune's Yerawada and Kothrud reported highest noise levels in the city during Ganesh festival this year, according to Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB). As per MPCB data, Yerawada recorded the highest average noise level at 84.69 decibels, followed by Kothrud and Shaniwar Peth at 84.68 and 83.67 decibels, respectively. This year, noise pollution was monitored at 18 locations across Pune.

24.title: Didn't know much about Vicky, was won over when I met him: Katrina
24.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', said that her relationship with Vicky Kaushal was "unexpected and out of the blue". "I didn't even know much about Vicky. He was just a name I had heard...But when I met him, I was won over," she added. Vicky and Katrina tied the knot in December 2021.

25.title: I attempted to make 'Ponniyin...' but Mani Ratnam succeeded: Kamal Haasan
25.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan has revealed MGR had given him the rights to make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "I knew that either Mani Ratnam or I would make 'Ponniyin Selvan'. I attempted but Mani succeeded," Kamal added. Speaking about the time he wanted to make the film, Kamal stated Sivaji felt Rajinikanth would be perfect for 'Vandhiyathevan', whereas, he would play Aditya Karikalan.

26.title: Where is India broken?: BJP leader on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
26.article_body: Former UP Cabinet Minister Sidharth Nath Singh criticised Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said that he has a problem with the terminology of Congress. "Where is India broken, which Congress have come out to connect? India is not disintegrated...then how can you say so?" he added. "You had divided India on the basis of your issues," the BJP leader said.

27.title: Nothing can be better than this feeling: Anil on becoming grandparent
27.article_body: Speaking about becoming a grandparent, actor Anil Kapoor has said that he is always there by his newborn grandchild's side. Last month, Anil's daughter and actress Sonam Kapoor welcomed a baby boy. "Nothing can be better than this feeling. I would like to say my dialogue (from 'Dil Dhadakne Do'), 'I feel on top of the world'," he added.

28.title: US returns 58 looted antiquities worth $19 million to Italy
28.article_body: The US returned 58 stolen antiquities worth an estimated $19 million to Italy on Tuesday. The items, many on display at the New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art for years, included vases, platters and 'The Marble Head of Athena' worth an estimated $3 million. The antiquities were sold by convicted looters who used locals to raid unguarded sites in Italy.

29.title: Musk doesn't come to me for advice on how to fail to buy Twitter: Gaiman on Musk's tweet
29.article_body: After a Twitter user asked author Neil Gaiman's opinion on Tesla CEO not liking 'The Rings of Power' series, the 'Sandman' writer tweeted, "Elon Musk doesn't come to me for advice on how to fail to buy Twitter, and I don't go to him for film, TV or literature criticism." Notably, Musk had tweeted, "Tolkien is turning in his grave."

30.title: Are you kidding me: EaseMyTrip Co-founder shares chat with candidate refusing to join
30.article_body: EaseMyTrip Co-founder Prashant Pitti took to Twitter to share a screenshot of a chat with a candidate after the latter dropped out on the joining day. Pitti replied to the candidate’s text, "Are you kidding me?" and in the caption wrote, "Someone please solve this hiring issue. This is hugely prevalent and ends up wasting so much time and resource."

31.title: UP teacher punches Class 2 Dalit student, rubs his head on ground
31.article_body: A seven-year-old Dalit student studying in Class 2 was allegedly punched and his head was rubbed on the ground by a teacher in a government primary school in UP's Bhadohi district on Tuesday. According to police, the boy was playing in the school ground when the incident occurred. The student suffered an injury near his right eye, added police.

32.title: We're not the underdogs anymore: SL's Bhanuka Rajapaksa after win over India
32.article_body: After their six-wicket win over India in their Asia Cup Super 4 match, Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said, "We're not underdogs anymore." He added, "We want to win the title. We are pretty confident, we are backing our team." Rajapaksa remained unbeaten at 25 off 17 deliveries to help Sri Lanka chase down India's 174-run target.

33.title: Only clay idols allowed immersion at Hyd's Hussain Sagar: Telangana govt
33.article_body: Telangana government issued a clarification around Ganesh idol immersion at Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar on Tuesday and said that the immersion of only clay idols is permitted in the lake. The state government further clarified that idols made out of Plaster of Paris (PoP) are prohibited for immersion in the lake due to a High Court's order dated July 21, 2022.

34.title: Spewing venom: Baghel on Assam CM's 'start Bharat Jodo Yatra in Pak' remark
34.article_body: Following Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's "Congress should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan" remark, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said, "He's spewing venom." Baghel added, "He must have visited RSS office and seen Akhand Bharat's map. BJP says Muslims [should] be sent to Pakistan and merge it for Akhand Bharat. What does it mean to send them and merge later?"

35.title: 5 cows killed, 10 injured after truck overturns in Bihar's Sasaram
35.article_body: Five cows were killed and 10 injured after a truck, in which they were allegedly being smuggled, overturned in Bihar's Sasaram on Tuesday. The injured cows were rescued by the police and are being treated with the help of the animal husbandry department, said a police official. The locals caught a person and handed him over to the police.

36.title: Mother of US school shooting victim posts pic of daughter's grave as school reopens
36.article_body: Students went back to US' Robb Elementary school for the first time since the shooting that killed 19 kids and two teachers. In a tweet, Kimberly Garcia, whose daughter Amerie Jo Garza was among the deceased, wrote, "I don't get to post back to school photos of you." Garcia wrote this along with a picture of her daughter's grave.

37.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father gets death threat, mail demanding money
37.article_body: In a complaint made to the police, Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has stated that he got a mail wherein a threat was made to his life and money was demanded from him. The person who sent the mail, which was in Hindi, said that Singh should stop speaking against Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar.

38.title: US woman killed by bull shark while snorkeling in Bahamas
38.article_body: A US woman was killed in a shark attack while snorkeling in the Bahamas on Tuesday. The victim, who was a passenger on a Royal Caribbean cruise ship, was attacked by the shark while "on an independent shore excursion" in Nassau, cruise officials said. Last month, an eight-year-old British boy survived an attack by three sharks in the Bahamas.

39.title: Should know his age: Maha CM on Aaditya Thackeray's 'traitor' remark
39.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde, while reacting to Aaditya Thackeray's 'traitor' remark for rebel Shiv Sena leaders, said the latter "should know his age and speak accordingly". "What we're today is because of...late Balasaheb Thackeray and his school of thought. But he (Aaditya) and others drifted...from Balasaheb's thought for power which forced us to take this strong step," Shinde added.

40.title: Karen Khachanov knocks Kyrgios out of US Open after 5-set quarter-final win
40.article_body: World number 31 Karen Khachanov defeated Australian Nick Kyrgios in three hours and 39 minutes in US Open quarter-final on Wednesday. Khachanov won with the scoreline of 7-5, 4-6, 7-5, 6-7(3-7), 6-4 to enter the first Grand Slam semi-final of his career. The 26-year-old Russian will now face Norway's Casper Ruud for a place in the final on Friday night.

41.title: Teen kills father with a rolling pin after latter abuses wife in Delhi
41.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended a 17-year-old boy for allegedly killing his 42-year-old father with a wooden rolling pin at their home in the Sarai Rohilla area. The incident took place in August after the boy found his father abusing his mother, police said. The minor told the police that he only wanted to teach his father a lesson.

42.title: Nissan Motors to buy automotive battery firm Vehicle Energy Japan
42.article_body: Japan's Nissan Motor said it will acquire all the common shares in Vehicle Energy Japan held by the lithium-ion battery maker's biggest shareholder, Innovation Network Corporation of Japan. After the acquisition, Vehicle Energy Japan will become Nissan's consolidated subsidiary and will hold shares alongside Maxell and Hitachi Astemo. Financial details of the deal are yet to be known.

43.title: B'luru's Epsilon housing Wipro's Premji, Byju's CEO, submerged; residents evacuated
43.article_body: Bengaluru’s upscale gated apartment, Epsilon, which houses billionaires like Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji and Byju Raveendran, has been submerged under water. Videos on social media showed inflatable boats being used to evacuate residents from their apartments while cars and other vehicles were surrounded by water. Notably, a basic villa in Epsilon costs ₹10 crore.

44.title: Influential political families' vested interests deprived Punjab youth from jobs: CM
44.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said Punjab has lagged behind in the process of development and youth had been deprived of employment opportunities because of the vested interests of influential political families. "The hands of these families are drenched with treachery and ruining the future of younger generations. These families connived with forces for getting personal benefits," CM Mann added.

45.title: 30,000 from Myanmar took refuge in Mizoram since 2021 coup: Govt
45.article_body: As many as 30,401 people from Myanmar have taken refuge in Mizoram since the military coup in the country in February last year, said state Home Minister Lalchamliana. The government has provided identity cards and refugee certificates to 30,177 of them. So far, ₹3 crore relief has been disbursed by the state for them, added the minister.

46.title: Ratnam is 1st pan-India director, Roja & Bombay reached entire India: Shankar
46.article_body: During an event for 'Ponniyin Selvan', filmmaker Shankar said that Mani Ratnam is the first pan-India director. "His films like 'Roja' and 'Bombay' reached all over India because of his style, work ethic and work. We are travelling on the path...discovered by Mani sir," Shankar added. Ratnam's upcoming film 'Ponniyin Selvan' features actors Vikram and Karthi.

47.title: 3 men pose as NSG commandos to cheat people, arrested in Gurugram
47.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday arrested a gang of three men who posed as commandos of the National Security Guard (NSG) to cheat people. The accused directly called people and cheated them on the pretext of selling furniture, police said. The incident came to light after Rambir, a resident of Dhana village, was cheated of ₹15,000 by the accused, police added.

48.title: New UK PM vows to cut taxes, strengthen NHS and tackle energy crisis
48.article_body: In her debut speech outside the 10 Downing Street, UK's new Prime Minister Liz Truss said she would cut taxes to spur economic growth, strengthen the National Health Service (NHS) and deal with the energy crisis "hands on". Truss has named the top members of her team including Therese Coffey, UK's first female Deputy Prime Minister.

49.title: Lawrence reveals she had 2 miscarriages, including one alone in Canada in her early 20s
49.article_body: Actress Jennifer Lawrence, in an interview with Vogue, revealed that she had two miscarriages. She said that her first miscarriage occurred when she was in her early 20s, adding that she was then alone in Canada's Montreal. Her second miscarriage happened a couple of years ago. She gave birth to her first child in February this year.

50.title: 17-year-old girl accuses Nepal cricket captain Sandeep Lamichhane of raping her in hotel
50.article_body: Nepal cricket team captain Sandeep Lamichhane, who has previously played for Delhi Capitals in the IPL, has been accused of raping a 17-year-old girl. The girl has alleged that 22-year-old Lamichhane raped her in a hotel room in Kathmandu on August 21, a day before Lamichhane left for the bilateral series with Kenya. Police have begun investigation into the matter.

51.title: Father of child bitten by dog in Ghaziabad society lift confronts dog owner, video surfaces
51.article_body: After a video from Ghaziabad went viral where a dog bit a child inside a housing society's lift, another video has surfaced online showing the child's father confronting the dog owner. In the video, the woman is seen walking her dog in the building's basement and the man is heard saying that she is refusing to reveal her flat number.

52.title: UP's Bareilly DM bans wearing jeans, T-shirts in office
52.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly District Magistrate Shivakant Dwivedi has ordered a ban on wearing casual attire such as jeans, T-shirts in office. "Government employees and officers should wear formal attire to make them look like they are officers. Those who have to wear casuals can wear it outside," said Dwivedi. The administration warned of action if the dress code is violated.

53.title: UN calls for safety zone around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
53.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) urged Russia and Ukraine to establish a "nuclear safety and security protection zone" around the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. "We're playing with fire...something very, very catastrophic could take place," Rafael Grossi, Director General of the IAEA warned. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres urged both sides to agree on a "demilitarised perimeter".

54.title: Rupee falls to 79.88 as dollar returns to a 20-year high of 110.6
54.article_body: The rupee lowered by four paise on Wednesday to 79.88 against the US dollar from its previous close as the latter returned to a 20-year high of 110.6. The dollar index, which gauges the American currency against yen, pound, euro, franc, Canadian dollar and krona, surged as much as 0.5%. The Brent crude futures fell 1.33% to $91.60 per barrel.

55.title: Railway official assaulted by 2 ticketless passengers in Gujarat
55.article_body: A Deputy Chief Ticket Inspector of the Western Railway (WR) was assaulted by two persons travelling without tickets in a passenger train near Bilimora station in Gujarat on Tuesday. They attacked the official, MM Qazi, after refusing to pay a fine. They also stole a mobile phone and cash from Qazi, said a WR officer.

56.title: Video shows Putin watching military drills attended by Indian, Chinese forces
56.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday oversaw military drills in his country's far east, donning his military uniform. A video showed Putin attending the drills along with Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu and military Chief of Staff Valery Gerasimov. The military exercises, called Vostok 2022, involve more than 50,000 troops from India, China and several other countries.

57.title: Bengaluru Police shares traffic advisory as some parts of city remain waterlogged
57.article_body: The Bengaluru Police shared traffic advisory on Wednesday as some parts of Bengaluru continued to remain waterlogged. As per the advisory, near Ecospace of Outer Ring Road only heavy vehicle movement was allowed from Marathahalli towards Silk Board while traffic movement was blocked on Channasandra Road till waterlogging is cleared. Meanwhile, slow traffic movement was reported on Belathur Road.

58.title: Punjab government yet to clear salaries of its employees for August: Reports
58.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government is yet to clear the salaries of its employees for the month of August, as per reports. The government had reportedly been facing a financial crunch since the GST compensation regime came to an end. "The delay was due to...government investing ₹1,000 crore to make money as interest for the state exchequer," an official said.

59.title: Diversity has intrinsic worth, furthers our understanding of fairness: SC judge
59.article_body: Diversity results in innovative thinking, decision-making and richness in the originality of scholarly thought, SC judge Justice DY Chandrachud said. On the aspect of diversity, Justice Chandrachud said, "An intrinsic worth in itself...furthers our understanding of fairness and social justice." "Learning is impoverished when it happens in groups of like-minded people," he added.

60.title: Delhi's ban on firecrackers to continue this Diwali, online sale of crackers also banned
60.article_body: Delhi Government has extended the ban on manufacturing, storing, sale and bursting of firecrackers in continuation of last year's directive. Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said that use of all types of firecrackers is being completely banned so that people's lives can be saved from pollution. This year, Delhi government has also banned the online sale and delivery of firecrackers.

61.title: Superhero films worldwide have high budgets, we don't have such budgets: Rakesh
61.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, speaking about 'Krrish 4', has said that the film has a big budget and the scripting is almost done. However, he added, "The challenge for me is that in today's..age, people...watch superhero films from all over the world." Rakesh said, "These superhero films are made on very big budgets. And we don't have such big budgets."

62.title: 51% of school students face problems in learning online: NCERT survey
62.article_body: As many as 51% of school students face difficulty in learning online, as per a survey on the mental health and well-being of students conducted by the National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT). Over 33% comply with peer pressure most of the time, it added. Over 45% are not satisfied with their body image, the survey stated.

63.title: Apple to appeal Brazil govt's sales ban of iPhone without charger
63.article_body: After the Brazilian government on Tuesday ordered Apple to stop selling iPhones without a battery charger in the country, the company said it will appeal the order. It also said it would continue to work with Brazilian consumer protection agency SENACON to "resolve their concerns". Apple was fined 12.275 million reais (around ₹19 crore) by the Brazilian Justice Ministry.

64.title: Pune RTI activist booked for blackmailing ex-corporator's husband
64.article_body: An RTI activist, identified as Jitendra Ashok Bhosale from Pune, has been booked for allegedly blackmailing and trying to extort money from a former corporator's husband. According to police, Bhosale demanded ₹25 lakh from Arjun Jagtap, threatening him of exposing his alleged involvement in illegal construction. He allegedly threatened to defame Jagtap and his wife before civic polls.

65.title: India reports 5,379 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases at 50,594
65.article_body: India has reported 5,379 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours and 27 more deaths, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 4,417 COVID-19 cases, the lowest since June 2022. Active cases in the country dropped to 50,594, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.67%.

66.title: Man in Mercedes picks up subsidised food items from govt shop in Punjab; video viral
66.article_body: A viral video shows a man in a Mercedes taking subsidised food items from a government ration shop in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. The ration is available at these shops for Below Poverty Line (BPL) people who can't afford to buy it from a grocery store. The driver later said that it was his relative's car who does not live in India.

67.title: Ratan Tata's 92-year-old stepmother Simone Tata attends Cyrus Mistry's funeral
67.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was cremated at the Worli crematorium in central Mumbai on Tuesday.  Industry doyen Ratan Tata's 92-year-old stepmother Simone Tata was also present at the funeral. Wheelchair-bound Simone Tata arrived at the crematorium in a special van. However, no other senior official from the Tata Group attended the funeral.

68.title: Registry of 5 illegal flats to be cancelled in Gurugram's Palam Vihar
68.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner on Tuesday directed to cancel registration of five illegally constructed flats in Palam Vihar's C2 block. "Around 30 flats, built in violation of rules, were sealed on Monday. The owner of one of the plots on which multiple dwelling units were built broke the seal and resumed construction," a Department of Town and Country Planning official said.

69.title: 7,000 sq m plot allotted for Lata Mangeshkar music college in Mumbai
69.article_body: The Maharashtra government has allocated a 7,000 square metres plot to set up an international music college in the name of late singer Lata Mangeshkar. The college will be established in the Kalina campus of the University of Mumbai. It will be called Bharat Ratna Lata Deenanath Mangeshkar International College of Music and Museum.

70.title: Pune man kills grandmother, dumps body parts in river over property
70.article_body: A 20-year-old man killed her 62-year-old grandmother and chopped her body into pieces before dumping them into a river over a property dispute in Pune, said police on Tuesday. The accused, Guddu Gaikwad, planned the murder with his father. According to police, the victim, who owned a house and some gold ornaments, had refused to give money to his grandson.

71.title: Instagram will remove shopping page, other features: Report
71.article_body: Instagram is reportedly planning to roll back several of its shopping features. In an internal memo to the staff, the company stated that the existing shopping page will eventually disappear due to "shifts in company priorities". It added that over the next few months, Instagram will test a less personalised version of the shopping page, called 'Tab Lite'.

72.title: Wanted to be part of 'Ponniyin Selvan', Mani Ratnam denied it: Rajinikanth
72.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth revealed that he wanted to be a part of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'. "I asked Mani sir if I can play Periya Pazhuvettaraiyar. He denied the offer saying my fans would not be happy," he said. Rajinikanth added, "Anyone else would have taken it, but Mani denied it and this is what makes him unique!"

73.title: Mumbai reports 0 COVID-19 deaths for 1st time in 15 days
73.article_body: Mumbai did not report a single death linked to COVID-19 for the first time in about 15 days i.e. since August 22 on Tuesday and the death toll remained at 19,711, according to BMC. The city recorded 285 new infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 11,46,725 cases. As many as 516 patients recovered from the infection.

74.title: Pune-based institute signs MoU with DIAT to promote naturopathy
74.article_body: Pune-based National Institute of Naturopathy (NIN) has signed an MoU with Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT), a DRDO-funded university, to promote naturopathy treatment. Under the agreement, an out-patient department will be set up and yoga sessions will be conducted at DIAT. "There is an increasing demand for naturopathy and yoga," said NIN Director Professor K Satya Lakshmi.

75.title: Mumbai to witness light rainfall, thundershowers for next 48 hrs: IMD
75.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall in Mumbai and suburbs for the next 48 hours. There is also a possibility of thundershowers with temperatures expected to hover around 26°C to 31°C, IMD added. According to IMD official Sushma Nair, long-term observations indicate better rainfall in September than what the city saw in August.

76.title: When Bumrah, Axar & Shami are back, India will have edge: Gavaskar
76.article_body: After India's two consecutive defeats in the ongoing Asia Cup, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said India must play their World Cup team in the upcoming T20 series against Australia and South Africa. "When Bumrah, Axar and Shami [are] back, India will have a sharper edge...But we want them now to get more overs under their belt," he added.

77.title: Vedant Patel becomes 1st Indian-American to hold daily US State Dept presser
77.article_body: Vedant Patel, Principal Deputy Spokesperson for US State Department, on Tuesday created history by becoming the first Indian-American to hold the daily State Department news conference. Patel was filling in for State Department Spokesperson Ned Price, who's on a vacation. Patel held the presser with "utmost professionalism", Matt Hill, White House's Senior Associate Communications Director, said.

78.title: CBI raids West Bengal Law Minister Moloy Ghatak's 6 premises in coal scam case
78.article_body: CBI officials are conducting raids at six premises of West Bengal Law Minister Moloy Ghatak in connection with the coal scam case. While five premises are in Kolkata, one is in Asansol. CBI has alleged that illegal coal mining was done near Asansol and transactions of ₹1,300 crore were allegedly done, the bulk of which went to several influential people.

79.title: Musk's lawyer seeks to delay Twitter trial to investigate whistleblower's claims
79.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer urged that the trial over the $44 billion Twitter deal should be delayed by several weeks to allow Musk to investigate a whistleblower's claims. "Doesn't justice demand a few weeks to look into this?" said Musk’s lawyer. Twitter's former head of security, Peiter Zatko, accused Twitter of falsely claiming it had a solid security plan.

80.title: Google to launch its 1st smartwatch, Pixel 7 phones on October 6
80.article_body: Google on Tuesday announced that it will launch Pixel 7, Pixel 7 Pro and its first smartwatch Pixel Watch during its 'Made by Google' event on October 6. It first gave a sneak peek of these products during its I/O event. Pixel 7 phones will run on Android 13 and feature the next generation of Google's custom mobile chip, Tensor.

81.title: Cong should start 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan, India is united: Assam CM
81.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that India is connected and united, so Congress’ Rahul Gandhi should start the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Pakistan. "India was divided in 1947 during Congress...What are the benefits of doing this yatra in India?" Sarma asked. His statement came a day before the launch of Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

82.title: Couple killed, child injured over domestic dispute in East Delhi
82.article_body: A man and his wife died following an alleged stabbing incident in East Delhi's Guru Angad Nagar area on Tuesday. The couple has two children, including a 13-year-old boy who also sustained injuries. He was later admitted to hospital for treatment. According to police, the incident took place over an alleged marital dispute. Further investigation is underway, police added.

83.title: Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty below 17,600 in opening trade
83.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Wednesday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell 400 points to open at 58,800, while the Nifty lost 126 points to open at 17,528.90. Bharti Airtel, IndusInd Bank, ONGC, RIL and HDFC were among the major losers, while stocks of HUL, Dr Reddy's, Nestle India and Shree Cement gained.

84.title: Bajrang Dal stops Ranbir, Alia from entering Ujjain temple over actor's beef comments
84.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were stopped on Tuesday from entering the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain by Bajrang Dal workers over the actor's past comments on eating beef. Videos of police cane charging the protesters surfaced online. Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt were at the temple to offer prayers ahead of the release of their film 'Brahmastra'.

85.title: Casting will be locked later: Basu on rumours of Jennifer being in Aashiqui 3
85.article_body: 'Aashiqui 3' director Anurag Basu has reacted to rumours of actress Jennifer Winget being cast in the film along with actor Kartik Aaryan. "Well, I've been also hearing about these rumours. However, honestly, we're currently at a very nascent stage. We're currently ideating about various other aspects of film-making," he stated. Anurag added, "Casting will be locked later on."

86.title: I was thinking of bowling Hooda, but SL's right-handers batted for long: Rohit
86.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down India's 174-run target in their Asia Cup Super 4 match on Tuesday, India captain Rohit Sharma said he was thinking of bowling Deepak Hooda to take advantage of the bigger boundary, but it didn't work out as Sri Lanka's right-handers batted for very long. "In the end, SL held their nerves quite well," added Rohit.

87.title: More rain to hit Bengaluru in next three hours: IMD
87.article_body: A thunderstorm with lightning and light to moderate rain is expected in urban and rural regions of Bengaluru in the next three hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Widespread rains for next five days in coastal and north interior Karnataka, three days of widespread rains...in the next two days in south interior Karnataka," an IMD scientist said on Tuesday.

88.title: Rahul pays tribute to Rajiv Gandhi in Sriperumbudur ahead of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
88.article_body: Ahead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday attended a prayer gathering at the memorial of his father and ex-PM Rajiv Gandhi in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu. He paid floral tribute at his father’s memorial. "I lost my father to politics of hate and division. I will not lose my beloved country to it too," Rahul tweeted.

89.title: Malicious attempt to disparage education system: Jamiat on madrassas' survey
89.article_body: UP government's move to conduct a survey of madrassas in the state is a "malicious attempt" to disparage this education system, Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind said on Tuesday. "Madrassas are very beneficial. This system, provided to us by our elders, is unparalleled worldwide, so it will be safeguarded at all costs," the Jamiat quoted its President Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani as saying.

90.title: 1981 Indian Airlines hijacker Gajinder reveals his Pakistan location in Facebook post
90.article_body: Gajinder Singh, a hijacker of a 1981 Indian Airlines flight, has revealed his location in Pakistan in a Facebook post on Monday. Singh was seen standing in front of Panja Sahib Gurudwara at Hasan Abdal in Pakistan's province of Punjab. The flight carrying over 100 passengers to Amritsar was forcibly diverted to Lahore.

91.title: Car in Mistry's accident had 7 past cases of speeding & jumping signals: Police
91.article_body: The Mercedes SUV in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed, is now known to have at least seven traffic violation cases of speeding and jumping signals from 2020 till now, said the police. However, the police are yet to ascertain who was behind the wheel at the time of these offences. Mistry's accident took place in Palghar.

92.title: Karnataka Forest Minister Umesh Katti dies of heart attack aged 61
92.article_body: Karnataka Forest and Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Minister Umesh Katti died of heart attack aged 61 on Tuesday. "I've lost a very close friend of mine...It's a huge loss...He has left a huge vacuum which is very difficult to fill up," CM Basavaraj Bommai said. Katti collapsed at his Bengaluru home and was rushed to a hospital.

93.title: Save us from bicycle thieves: Mumbai's Dabbawalas tell Dy CM
93.article_body: The Mumbai Dabbawala Association has written a formal complaint to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, asking for security for their cycles parked at railway stations after several cases of theft were reported. In three days, six bicycles of Dabbawalas have been stolen from outside railway stations. "Each cycle costs around ₹10,000,'' said Mumbai Dabbawala Association's President.

94.title: Indian batsmen came hard, but we did well to keep them to 173: Dasun Shanaka
94.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said their batting unit won it for them against India in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match on Tuesday. "The Indian batsmen came hard, but we did well to keep them to 173...We know what we can do in this tournament," he added. Sri Lanka chased down India's 174-run target in 19.5 overs.

95.title: Will surely see Xi at G20 summit if Chinese Prez attends it: Biden
95.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday said that he would "surely see" Xi Jinping at the November G20 summit in Indonesia if his Chinese counterpart attends it. Biden and Xi previously discussed the possible meeting during their July 28 phone call, which took place amid heightened tensions over US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's trip to Taiwan.

96.title: 16-year-old Class 10 girl student killed in hit-and-run case in Pune
96.article_body: A 16-year-old Class 10 girl was killed in a hit-and-run case in Pune's Khadki, officials said. The deceased, a resident of Pathare Vasti in Lohegaon, was hit by a dumper on Monday afternoon while riding her bicycle, officials added. The accident took place when the victim was going to tuition class after her school, officials stated.

97.title: ED arrests former NSE CEO Ravi Narain in money laundering case
97.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested Ravi Narain, the former Managing Director and CEO of the National Stock Exchange (NSE), in connection with a money laundering case related to the alleged illegal phone-tapping of the exchange's employees. The ED had earlier arrested another former NSE MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and former Mumbai Commissioner of Police Sanjay Pandey in the case.

98.title: Delhi govt to decongest 77 traffic hotspots: CM Arvind Kejriwal
98.article_body: Delhi government has decided to decongest 77 traffic hotspots in the national capital, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. "We will redesign roads and construct flyovers...foot overbridges to rid Delhiites of traffic snarls," he added. In February 2017, a task force constituted by the Lieutenant Governor identified 77 road corridors in Delhi for implementing measures to tackle severe traffic congestion.

99.title: ByteDance fires hundreds of employees from video gaming division: Report
99.article_body: TikTok's parent company ByteDance has reportedly fired hundreds of employees from its video gaming division in Hong Kong. According to a report, ByteDance is also cutting jobs at Jiangnan Studio, its game development studio in the Hangzhou district. Earlier in June, ByteDance shut down a game development studio and fired more than 100 employees.

100.title: Woman bites off mother-in-law's fingers in fight over TV volume in Thane
100.article_body: A 60-year-old woman was allegedly bitten on three fingers of her right hand by her daughter-in-law in a fight over television volume in Thane. The incident reportedly took place on Monday night. According to police, the duo is always involved in fights over petty issues. A case has been registered against the daughter-in-law at Shivaji Nagar police station, police added.

101.title: Goan-origin Suella Braverman appointed as UK's new Home Secretary
101.article_body: Goan-origin Suella Braverman, the Conservative Party member of Parliament for Fareham in south-east England, was on Tuesday appointed as UK's new Home Secretary. Braverman, who was a candidate for UK Prime Minister, dropped out in the second round in July and supported Liz Truss instead. Suella, a Cambridge University law graduate, married Rael Braverman in 2018.

102.title: Burning Man Festival at US desert ends with 8-hour traffic jam; pics go viral
102.article_body: The nine-day Burning Man Festival in US' Nevada came to an end on Monday. Those leaving from the venue in the Black Rock desert found themselves stuck in an eight-hour-long traffic jam, with many experiencing fuel shortages at stations along the way. Pictures showing the traffic jam went viral on social media.

103.title: 7 monkeys killed, their bodies dumped outside village in UP
103.article_body: Some people killed seven monkeys and threw their bodies outside Gura Barela village in Uttar Pradesh on Monday, police said. "A video, which shows the monkeys with their hands tied and black oil on their eyes, has...gone viral," Divisional Forest Officer Ashok Kumar said. The bodies of the monkeys have been sent to the Indian Veterinary Research Institute for post-mortem.

104.title: Nitish, Tejashwi to attend INLD rally; Sharad Pawar also invited
104.article_body: Indian National Lok Dal (INLD) leader Abhay Chautala confirmed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and his deputy Tejashwi Yadav will attend the party's rally on September 25 in Haryana. NCP chief Sharad Pawar, Farooq Abdullah and Akhilesh Yadav have also been invited, Chautala said. Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will also be invited, he added.

105.title: MP's Kuno National Park to get 7 helipads for cheetah reintroduction
105.article_body: Kuno National Park (KNP) in MP's Sheopur district will see the construction of at least seven helipads in and around its vicinity to carry out the cheetah reintroduction project. Under this project, cheetahs will be brought from South Africa and Namibia to the national park. South Africa is yet to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) draft for exporting cheetahs.

106.title: Rahul known for 'Bharat Chodo': BJP leader on Cong's 'Bharat Jodo' Yatra
106.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday criticised Congress' upcoming 'Bharat Jodo' (uniting India) Yatra and said that Kerala Congress MP Rahul Gandhi is more famous for 'Bharat Chodo' (leaving India). Gandhi is scheduled to launch the yatra in Tamil Nadu's southern Kanniyakumari district on September 7. The five-month-long yatra will pass through 12 states and culminate in Kashmir.

107.title: US military to test launch an ICBM on Wednesday, Russia notified
107.article_body: The US military will test launch an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) on Wednesday, the Pentagon said. Russia has been notified of the upcoming launch, the Pentagon added. The US last month carried out the test launch of the Minuteman III ICBM after initially putting it off to avoid escalation in tensions with China.

108.title: Thousands protest hike in fuel prices in Indonesia
108.article_body: Thousands protested across Indonesian cities on Tuesday, demanding the government roll back the increase in fuel prices. Student and labour groups demonstrated in Jakarta, Surabaya, Makassar, Kendari, Aceh, and Yogyakarta as police said they expect protests to intensify. Over the weekend, Indonesian President Joko Widodo announced a cut in fuel subsidies that would increase prices by 30%.

109.title: Germany planning to drop mandatory mask rule on flights
109.article_body: The German government is planning to drop the mandatory mask rule on flights to and from the country. The present rules mandate masks to be worn on flights till September 23. The Free Democratic Party has demanded that the rule be dropped. Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said the mask rule could be re-imposed if coronavirus cases rise sharply.

110.title: Belarus plans law to revoke citizenship over 'extremism'
110.article_body: The Belarusian government is in the process of drafting legislation that will allow it to revoke the citizenship of Belarusians living abroad if found indulging in "extremism", interior minister of Belarus said on Tuesday. He added that such individuals would be handed a 30-year entry ban. Notably, several exiled opposition leaders have been declared "terrorists" by the Belarusian government.

111.title: Adriana Lima welcomes third child, names him Cyan
111.article_body: Model-actor Adriana Lima announced that she gave birth to her third child on August 29. Sharing a close-up of her son's eye on Instagram, Lima wrote, "Cyan now is our favorite color... the color of our baby boy's eyes. Welcome to our world CYAN LIMA LEMMERS". Cyan is Lima's first baby with boyfriend Andre Lemmers.

112.title: AAP boycotts EC's all-party meeting in Jammu, terms it a 'joke'
112.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) boycotted Election Commission's (EC) all-party meeting and staged a protest outside its Jammu office on Monday. Calling the meeting a "joke", AAP's Harsh Dev Singh said that suggestions made by the Opposition aren't paid heed to, adding that only BJP's decisions are implemented. "BJP doesn't want an end to its proxy rule in J&K," he added.

113.title: UP Cabinet approves ₹192 cr aid to help farmers prevent crop damage
113.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath-led UP Cabinet has approved ₹192.57 crore in aid for farmers facing challenges crop damage challenges. The money will be used to control weeds in the field and for the safe storage of ready crops by using ecological resources over the next five years. Another proposal for a 50% subsidy on storage units was also approved.

114.title: Lufthansa pilots call off strike after reaching deal in wage dispute
114.article_body: Pilots of German airlines Lufthansa have called off their second strike scheduled for this week after reaching a deal in their wage dispute with the company. The Vereinigung Cockpit (VC) pilots' union said that they had reached a deal on a comprehensive package and are yet to discuss details of the agreement. The strike was due to begin on Wednesday.

115.title: Over 700 children died in Somalian care centres this year: UNICEF
115.article_body: Over 700 children died in nutrition centres across Somalia this year, the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) said on Tuesday. Nutrition centres care for children who suffer from acute malnutrition. "This is less than 1% of the children who were admitted, cured and discharged... (but) this number could be more, as many deaths...go unreported," said a UNICEF official.

116.title: Holiday Inn-owner IHG's tech system hit by 'unauthorised activity'
116.article_body: The owner of Holiday Inn, IHG said that its technology systems were hit by 'unauthorised activity' which disrupted the bookings on its apps and website. IHG said it has hired external specialists for the investigation, and is currently notifying the regulatory bodies. The company said that it has implemented a response plan and is assessing the impact of the incident.

117.title: Indian men's hockey team is focussing on every aspect of game: Rohidas
117.article_body: Indian men's hockey team defender Amit Rohidas said that his side is looking forward to the new season of FIH Hockey Pro League, beginning October 28. "It's a new challenge and a new opportunity for us," he added. "From defending to finishing along with our fitness, we are currently focussing on every aspect of the game," he further said.

118.title: SC issues notice to UP govt on Ashish Mishra's bail plea
118.article_body: The Supreme Court has issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government over Ashish Mishra's bail plea, in connection to the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. Mishra is facing a murder case for the October 3, 2021 incident in which eight people including four farmers were killed in Lakhimpur Kheri. The Allahabad High Court dismissed Mishra's bail plea on July 26.

119.title: Govt gives coal plants 2 more years to install emissions equipment
119.article_body: The Centre has extended its deadline for coal-fired power plants by two years to install equipment to cut sulphur emissions. Initially, a 2017 deadline was set to install flue gas desuphurisation (FGD) to reduce emissions and last year it was extended to 2025. As per the new order, power plants will be forcibly retired if they don't comply by 2027.

120.title: India lose to SL in T20 Asia Cup for 1st time, virtually out of race to reach final
120.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated India by six wickets in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match on Tuesday. This is India's first defeat against Sri Lanka in T20 Asia Cup history. With the defeat, India are virtually out of race to reach the final of Asia Cup 2022 after having earlier lost to Pakistan in the Super 4 stage.

121.title: One of the best of his generation: Mbappe on 22-year-old Vlahovic
121.article_body: Calling 22-year-old Dusan Vlahovic a quality striker, Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward Kylian Mbappe said the Juventus striker is one of the best of his generation. "He can do much better going forward, he has so much to give," he added. "He has already shown so much...He will be a top striker in the coming years," Mbappe further said.

122.title: Porsche won't become a shareholder: Red Bull confirms F1 deal off
122.article_body: Red Bull F1 advisor Helmut Marko revealed the team's talks for a deal with Porsche have collapsed. Rumours claimed Porsche was looking to enter F1 in 2026 by buying a 50% stake in Red Bull and becoming an engine manufacturer. The deal broke down as Porsche reportedly wanted a greater say in the team and Red Bull upped their price.

123.title: Scholarship declared for descendants of Indians martyred in B'desh war
123.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina on Tuesday announced the Mujib Scholarship for direct descendants of Indian soldiers killed or grievously injured in the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War. As many as 200 family members of Indian Army personnel will reportedly receive the scholarship, which will be conferred on Wednesday. A total of 1,984 Indian Army personnel were reportedly killed in the war.

124.title: Police destroy 35 kg IED which it recovered in J&K; video emerges
124.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) weighing around 30-35 kg from an orchard on the outskirts of Srinagar on Tuesday. The IED was recovered after police received input regarding presence of militants in Khonmoh. A video showed a cloud of smoke and dust in a forest area after police destroyed the IED through a controlled explosion.

125.title: 'PS-1' is coming together of Rahman & Mani Ratnam's talent: Aishwarya
125.article_body: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan said 'Ponniyin Selvan Part One' is the "incredible coming together of iconic talents AR Rahman and Mani Ratnam". "I had the privilege of working with them at the beginning of my career- this talented duo, with Iruvar, and here I am again, as part of Ponniyin Selvan," she said. Aishwarya plays Queen Nandini in the film.

126.title: We thought 'Bhabi Ji…' wouldn't last for more than 3 months: Rohitashv
126.article_body: Television actor Rohitashv Gour said the team of 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' didn't think that the show would run for more than three months. The actor said the show, which is now in its eighth year, worked because of its pure comedy. He praised the writers for "evolving and bringing up new creative ideas to keep the audiences hooked".

127.title: Harmanpreet nominated for FIH Player of Year Award
127.article_body: Indian hockey player Harmanpreet Singh was named among five nominees for the FIH Men's Player of the Year award. Meanwhile, PR Sreejesh and Savita Punia were shortlisted for the best male and female goalkeeper awards for the FIH Hockey Stars Awards 2021-22. Notably, all three, Harmanpreet, Savita and Sreejesh, won the awards last year as well.

128.title: After dispute with husband, woman sets 3-yr-old son afire in Ludhiana
128.article_body: After dispute with husband, a woman allegedly set her three-year-old son afire at her parents' house in a village in Punjab's Ludhiana district. The police booked the woman, Rupinder Kaur, on charges of attempt to murder based on the complaint of her mother, Manjit Kaur. The boy is undergoing treatment at a Chandigarh-based hospital and is stated to be critical.

129.title: Video shows aurora lights above Earth's atmosphere after solar storm hits Earth
129.article_body: A video shows aurora lights over the Earth's atmosphere. "This time-lapse video shows an orbital pass above an aurora-draped Indian Ocean all the way to a moonlit Coral Sea east of Australia," the caption read. The video was shot after a stream of solar wind struck the Earth and sparked a geomagnetic storm, which produced an aurora in some regions.

130.title: Milind Soman & Ankita trek up to 17,000 ft in Ladakh; share pics
130.article_body: Milind Soman and his wife Ankita Konwar were in Ladakh where the two completed "a trek of 55 kms to climb up to 17,000 feet and back" in four days. Sharing a video that featured herself with Milind, Ankita wrote that she learnt a lot and is "forever grateful". In his earlier post, Milind described Ladakh as beautiful and spiritual.

131.title: Never wanted to work with Khans, just Amitabh Bachchan: Ekta Kapoor
131.article_body: Producer Ekta Kapoor said she always "dreamt of working with" Amitabh Bachchan. "I don't think I had ever wanted to work with anyone, no Khans or anyone else, just Mr Amitabh Bachchan. Finally, it happened," she said at the trailer launch of 'Goodbye'. Talking about the Vikas Bahl directorial, Ekta said her experience of working on the film was different.

132.title: Dwayne Johnson surprises fans at Black Adam's test screening
132.article_body: Dwayne Johnson surprised his fans at the test screening of 'Black Adam'. The actor, who shared a video on his Instagram account, said he took some "invaluable learnings" from his "#1 boss- the audience". Talking about the DC film, Johnson said it is his "passion project to the bone" and he is "grateful" to have received the audience's early reactions.

133.title: I don't know when I am going to come back: Rafael Nadal after US Open exit
133.article_body: After crashing out of US Open 2022 in the round of 16, former world number one Rafael Nadal said, "I don't know when I am going to come back." "I have to go home, I have more important things than tennis to attend to," he added. He further said that his personal life comes before his professional life.

134.title: Streets of Anbuden will never forget what Chinna Thala meant to us: CSK on Raina
134.article_body: Reacting to Suresh Raina announcing his retirement, CSK tweeted, "The streets of Anbuden will never forget what Chinna Thala meant to each and every one of us!" CSK added, "Thank You, Mr. IPL! #ChinnaThalaForever." Raina played a total of 205 matches in IPL, scoring 5,528 runs. He slammed one hundred and 39 fifties in IPL.

135.title: Let's keep cricket free from personal attacks: Sachin after Arshdeep got abused online
135.article_body: After Arshdeep Singh got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Every athlete representing the country gives their best and plays for the nation always. They need our constant support & remember...in sports you win some & you lose some." He added, "Let's keep cricket or any other sport free from personal attacks."

136.title: World's most powerful telescope captures star-forming region 'Tarantula Nebula'
136.article_body: NASA on Tuesday said its James Webb Space Telescope (world's most powerful telescope) has captured the 'Tarantula Nebula' with thousands of never-before-seen young stars visible in the new image. The nebula is located 1,61,000 light-years in the Large Magellanic Cloud galaxy. It is the largest and brightest star-forming region in the galaxy group located closest to the Milky Way.

137.title: Kangana Ranaut's 'Tejas' release postponed: Reports
137.article_body: The release date of Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Tejas' has been postponed, as per reports. "Tejas was to release in October. However...there's still quite a bit of work pending [with VFX]," a source was quoted as saying. "The makers are looking at a release in either December 2022 or January 2023," the source added. 'Tejas' is written and directed by Sarvesh Mewara.

138.title: The Banshees of Inisherin gets 13-minute standing ovation at Venice
138.article_body: Colin Farrell's 'The Banshees of Inisherin' received a 13-minute standing ovation at its Venice Film Festival premiere, which is said to be the longest and loudest reception for any film this season. The film reunites Farrell with director Martin McDonagh and co-actor Brendan Gleeson after 'In Bruges' (2008). It will also premiere at Toronto International Film Festival this week.

139.title: Murder suspect attacked in Chennai court; gang rivalry suspected
139.article_body: Five men attempted to kill a murder suspect named Madurai Bala with weapons including knives inside the premises of a court in Chennai on Monday. A man also emptied a can of pepper into Bala's face. Policemen escorting Bala arrested three of the attackers, while two men escaped. Police suspect internal gang rivalry as the reason for the attack.

140.title: BSF seizes ₹3 lakh in Pak currency from Kartarpur Sahib returnees
140.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) has seized ₹3 lakh in Pakistani currency from a man and his grandmother who had returned from Gurdwara Darbar Sahib in Kartarpur, the police said. They added that they found 100 notes of ₹1,000 denomination, totalling ₹1 lakh and the rest were ₹5,000 notes. This was their second visit to the gurdwara.

141.title: South Africa announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
141.article_body: South Africa on Tuesday announced their 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Temba Bavuma will lead the squad, which also includes Quinton De Kock, Keshav Maharaj, David Miller, Wayne Parnell and Anrich Nortje. Rassie van der Dussen has not been included in the squad due to injury, while Tristan Stubbs will be making his T20 World Cup debut.

142.title: Still gravely concerned: IAEA on Ukrainian nuclear plant
142.article_body: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has released a report on the situation in the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine, which is in the middle of the war zone. "The IAEA is still gravely concerned about the situation...(but) hasn't found any indication that would give rise to a proliferation concern," it read. The nuclear plant is under Russian control.

143.title: 2021 semi-finalist Sabalenka beats US' Collins to enter US Open quarters
143.article_body: Last year's semi-finalist Aryna Sabalenka of Belarus beat US' Danielle Collins 3-6, 6-3, 6-2 in the fourth round at US Open 2022 on Monday. She'll now face Czech Karolina Pliskova in the quarter-final. On facing 2016 finalist Pliskova, Sabalenka said, "It's going to be tough." The 22nd-seeded Czech defeated 26th-seeded Victoria Azarenka 7-5, 6-7(5-7), 6-2 in the last 16.

144.title: Matter of serious concern: SC on cases under Section 66A of IT Act
144.article_body: The Supreme Court said that it is a 'matter of serious concern' that cases and FIRs were being registered under Section 66A of the IT Act, despite scrapping it in 2015. The court directed all state Chief Secretaries to take remedial measures against the use of the Act. In 2015, the Supreme Court called the Act 'vague and arbitrary'.

145.title: Man kills wife in Rajasthan; goes later to file her missing complaint
145.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 22-year-old wife to death and buried her body in a field in Birawai village in Rajasthan's Bharatpur. The accused, Pintu (26), then walked to the police station to file her missing complaint. The body of the deceased, Krishna, was exhumed from the field, police said. The exact reason behind the murder is still unknown.

146.title: I'd believe Paul Pogba over his brother: Mbappe on blackmail plot
146.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe said he would believe his teammate Paul Pogba over his brother Mathias Pogba in the multi-million blackmail-extortion plot. "He called me and gave me his version of events. It is his word against his brother's," said Mbappe. Mathias had claimed that Paul had paid a witch doctor to cast a spell on his France teammate Mbappe.

147.title: J&K official ordered non-locals to be added to voters' list: Mufti
147.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti accused a Baramulla district official of ordering workers from outside the state and central security personnel to be enrolled in the voters' list. The official responded stating "nothing like that" has happened and asked her for proof. Political parties in Kashmir have accused the Election Commission of trying to enrol non-locals into the voters' list.

148.title: Will win Sharad Pawar's home turf Baramati in 2024: Maharashtra BJP
148.article_body: The Maharashtra BJP said it will ally with the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena to win the Baramati constituency, the home turf of NCP chief Sharad Pawar, in the 2024 elections. The NCP hit back and asked the BJP to stop "daydreaming". BJP also claimed the alliance would win more than 45 of the 48 Lok Sabha seats in Maharashtra.

149.title: Women, poor ignored by previous Cong govts: Himachal Pradesh CM
149.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur alleged that the Congress ignored the welfare and progress of all sections, especially women and the poor, despite remaining in power in the state. "The state has a road network of 39,354 kilometres which has become possible due to Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana. Major credit goes to former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee," he said.

150.title: Create isolation wards in jails for people with contagious diseases: Delhi HC
150.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed Inspector General of Prisons to ensure isolation medical wards are created in jails so there's no compelling need to release inmates on bail, who may be suffering from contagious diseases. The court passed the order after hearing an interim bail application moved by an accused in an NDPS Act case, suffering from Herpes.

151.title: PM to inaugurate MP cheetah reintroduction project on his birthday
151.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be inaugurating the intercontinental cheetah translocation project at Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on September 17. PM Modi will also be interacting with women of self-help groups in Sheopur district's Karahal. An Air Force helicopter is being arranged to transport the eight African cheetahs from Delhi to Kuno to ensure minimum fatigue for them.

152.title: German military resumes reconnaissance operations in Mali
152.article_body: The German military resumed its reconnaissance operations in Mali on Tuesday, three weeks after operations were suspended due to a spat with Mali's government over flight clearances. Around 1,000 German troops are stationed in Mali, primarily to conduct reconnaissance for UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA. The mission was established in 2013 to support the battle against Islamist militants in Mali.

153.title: Said no to '3 Idiots' remake in South: Madhavan
153.article_body: Actor R Madhavan revealed that he rejected an offer to be a part of the South remake of his film '3 Idiots'. "It becomes very difficult to play the same thing all over again," he added. "I perform in the flow and then to analyse if I did as good as the original becomes too taxing for me," said Madhavan.

154.title: ED has given Sisodia clean chit in Delhi excise policy case: AAP
154.article_body: AAP said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has given a "clean chit" to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case. "ED carried out raids at various locations but did not come to Manish Sisodia's residence," said AAP, as justification for their claim. On Monday, the party claimed that CBI had given Sisodia a clean chit in the case.

155.title: Water is natural wealth: SC to Punjab, Haryana on Sutlej-Yamuna dispute
155.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Punjab and Haryana to resolve their differences and arrive at a negotiated water sharing agreement regarding the 26-year-old Sutlej-Yamuna dispute. "Individuals of the state...cannot say that only I need water...Water is a natural wealth and must be shared," the SC said. The Punjab counsel said the state's new government is willing to cooperate.

156.title: 2 women killed as pavement over water tank collapses in Rajasthan
156.article_body: Two women, aged 35 and 70, were killed after falling into a water tank after the pavement collapsed in Rajasthan's Udaipur district on Tuesday, police said. The women had gathered at a religious place when the incident took place. Five women were injured and have been admitted to a local hospital for treatment.

157.title: New Spanish law gives labour benefits to domestic cleaners, carers
157.article_body: The Spanish government on Tuesday approved a law giving domestic cleaners and carers the right to unemployment benefits, among other job securities. Labour Minister Yolanda Díaz said this will benefit over 370,000 people, 95% of whom are women. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez had earlier said the bill would "put an end to unacceptable injustice".

158.title: Adani Group says loans from public sector banks halved
158.article_body: After a CreditSights report called the Adani Group overleveraged, the conglomerate said that it has more than halved its loans from public sector banks. It added the net debt to Ebitda ratio of its companies has declined to 3.2 times from 7.6 times in last nine years. The group said it has a capital-management plan for all its portfolio companies.

159.title: Rihanna helps US restaurant staff clean up after staying late for dinner: Report
159.article_body: Rihanna recently helped tidy up a Michelin-starred restaurant in US after she and her friends asked staff to stay open past closing time, said a report. She was reportedly "seen helping the waitstaff clean up and push the bar stools back into place since she stayed so late". Rihanna had arrived at the restaurant with six friends, the report added.

160.title: Youth pours acid into girl's mouth, slits her throat for resisting rape in Andhra
160.article_body: A 14-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore was left in critical condition after a youth, who's related to her, attacked her with acid and slit her throat, police said. The accused attacked the girl in her house after she resisted his attempt to sexually assault her, multiple reports said. When she screamed, he slit her throat and fled, police said.

161.title: Doors of BJP 'permanently shut' on Nitish Kumar: Sushil Modi
161.article_body: Former Deputy CM of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi said BJP's doors have been "permanently shut" on Nitish Kumar after he broke the alliance with BJP in Bihar. "Nitish Kumar has put chameleons to shame in changing colours," Sushil Modi said. He claimed that Kumar had felt "suffocated" in the 20 months he ran his government in alliance with RJD earlier.

162.title: Biocon sells 5.4% stake in research arm Syngene for over ₹1,220 cr
162.article_body: Biopharma company Biocon on Tuesday sold 5.4% stake in its research arm Syngene International for over ₹1,220 crore through an open market transaction, according to a report. The drugmaker and the promoter of Syngene International has sold a total of 21,789,164 shares in the company, the report said. The shares were sold at an average price of ₹560.04 each.

163.title: Fair organiser, 2 operators arrested days after Mohali ride mishap
163.article_body: Two days after a swing collapsed during a fair in Punjab's Mohali, police on Tuesday arrested the organiser of the fair and two operators of the ride. At least 16 people were injured after the ride collapsed from a height of around 50 feet. Police said the accused were produced in court and remanded to one day in police custody.

164.title: Don't share phone number at malls: Kolkata Police to citizens
164.article_body: The Kolkata Police's cybercrime wing has issued warnings to citizens to not share their phone numbers at shopping malls or with friends they have only met on social media. "Sharing personal information in a public forum only makes us more vulnerable to cyber fraud," said the police. They added it was not mandatory to give your number at such places.

165.title: 27 killed as militants attack military post in south Yemen
165.article_body: At least 27 people were killed as suspected al-Qaida militants attacked a defence post in southern Yemen on Tuesday. The deceased included 21 troops and six militants in the ensuing gun battle, officials said. The militants targeted the security belt in Abyan province which is manned by troops loyal to the secessionist Southern Transitional Council.

166.title: Man shot dead after police chase in south London
166.article_body: A man was shot after a police chase in London on Monday and he subsequently succumbed at a hospital, the Metropolitan Police informed. Armed officers were pursuing a "suspect vehicle" in south London, the police said. Police added that the pursuit was brought to an end using "tactical contact" (a deliberate collision to bring a car to a stop).

167.title: Pieter Elbers begins new role as IndiGo's CEO
167.article_body: In a regulatory filing by IndiGo, the company said that Pieter Elbers has assumed charge as the new Chief Executive Officer of the company. The former CEO of KLM Royal Dutch Airlines was named as the next chief of IndiGo on May 18, 2022. Elbers is also a member of the executive committee of the Air France-KLM Group.

168.title: Hubble telescope captures images of 2 spiral galaxies 'overlapping'
168.article_body: The Hubble Space Telescope has captured an image of two spiral galaxies 'overlapping' one another. The galaxies named SDSS J115331 and LEDA 2073461 are more than a billion light-years away from Earth. Though it appears from the image that both the galaxies are overlapping each other, Hubble has determined that they are merely oriented and not actually interacting.

169.title: Video shows man beating friend to death with rod for failing to return utensils
169.article_body: A video showing a man beating his friend to death with a rod in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur after the latter did not return the utensils he had borrowed has surfaced online. The accused reportedly got enraged after he had an argument with the victim late at night. Police have recovered the victim's body and have also arrested the accused.

170.title: STF, police recover 11,136 bottles of illegal liquor in UP; 2 held
170.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) and local police on Tuesday recovered 11,136 bottles of illegal liquor worth ₹55 lakh in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur and arrested two smugglers. The liquor was being smuggled from Haryana to Bihar via Uttar Pradesh, STF Prayagraj region Deputy Superintendent Navendu Kumar said. The seizure was made from an apple truck on Kanpur-Prayagraj highway, he added.

171.title: 'Dancing shapes & pillars’ of auroras appear as geomagnetic storm hits Earth
171.article_body: Dancing shapes and pillars of auroras appeared in the sky in different parts of the world after a strong geomagnetic storm hit the Earth on September 4. A stream of charged particles called solar wind, flowing from a hole in the sun hit Earth creating a G2-class geomagnetic storm. Several people shared photos and videos of the auroras on Twitter.

172.title: Don't like being called 'character actor', who's a characterless actor: Pankaj
172.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said in a new interview that he has a problem with being called a 'character actor'. "I don't get the term 'character actor'. In films, everyone is playing a character...Who's a characterless actor?" he said, adding, "Everyone is doing a character including...lead actors." Pankaj also said he might quit acting after earning enough money after "several years".

173.title: Arctic lakes vanishing due to climate change: Study
173.article_body: Lakes in the Arctic are drying up as a result of climate change, a study stated. Over the past 20 years, lakes in Arctic have shrunk or dried completely across the northern parts of Canada, Russia, Greenland, Scandinavia and Alaska, it added. The thawing permafrost might decrease lake area by creating drainage channels and increasing soil erosion, researchers believe.

174.title: Top class: Irfan on India skipper Rohit's 32-ball fifty vs Sri Lanka
174.article_body: Irfan Pathan took to Twitter following India captain Rohit Sharma's 32-ball fifty against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match today and wrote, "Top class half-century from skipper Rohit Sharma." "Valuable innings under pressure," he added. This is Rohit's 28th half-century in T20Is. Sri Lanka all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne dismissed Rohit on 72.

175.title: Congress to fight Himachal polls in ex-CM Virbhadra's name: Pratibha Singh
