175.article_body: Congress will fight the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections in former CM Virbhadra Singh’s name, his wife and party’s state committee chief Pratibha Singh has said. She added that the senior party leader has done a lot of work for Himachal Pradesh. “We’re dead sure that we are going to win,” she further added.

176.title: We need KL Rahul at T20 WC, he can score hundreds in T20Is with ease: More
176.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More has said backing India opener KL Rahul for T20 World Cup 2022 is a process. "He's an important player for the team and we need him at the World Cup. He can score hundreds in T20Is with ease," he added. Rahul has scored 0, 36, 28 and 6 in the ongoing Asia Cup so far.

177.title: Rajnath Singh discusses defence ties with Mongolian counterpart
177.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met his Mongolian counterpart Saikhanbayar Gursed in Ulaanbaatar on Tuesday. “Productive interaction with Mongolia’s Defence Minister...had in-depth deliberations on adding further momentum to India-Mongolia defence cooperation,” he tweeted. Singh, who is on a five-day visit to Mongolia and Japan, is India's first Defence Minister to visit Mongolia officially.

178.title: Serena Williams is the reason why I can do the things that I'm doing: Tiafoe
178.article_body: Praising Serena Williams, fellow American Frances Tiafoe, who reached his maiden quarter-final at US Open, said the 23-time Grand Slam champion is "definitely" the reason why he can do the things that he's doing. "Like when I'm younger...reason I said to my dad that I can be a professional tennis player is seeing her...Venus [Williams] battle each other," he added.

179.title: Kolkata gets special 'shopping buses' ahead of Durga Puja celebrations
179.article_body: West Bengal's Transport Department has announced a special bus service in Kolkata's shopping zone ahead of the Durga Puja celebrations. Kolkata's shopping zone includes areas like Gariahat, Shyambazar and Esplanade and the buses will ply to these areas. State Transport Minister Snehasis Chakraborty said the buses would be functional till September 25 and will operate on weekends.

180.title: Chhattisgarh govt to open 5,000 kindergartens under 'Balwadi' scheme
180.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government launched the Balwadi (kindergarten) scheme under the New Education Policy to provide pre-primary education to children in the age group of 5-6 years. Over 5,000 Balwadis are set to open across the state from the current academic year, officials said. CM Bhupesh Baghel said that students in government schools will be taught in Chhattisgarhi once a week.

181.title: Your presence on the field was always electrifying: Harbhajan to Raina
181.article_body: Congratulating Suresh Raina following his retirement from all forms of cricket, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Thanks for all the countless memories, your presence on the field was always electrifying." He added, "My Best Wishes for your future innings." Raina and Harbhajan played together for Chennai Super Kings in the IPL for two seasons, 2018 and 2019.

182.title: 698 children dead in Zimbabwe due to measles outbreak, says govt
182.article_body: As many as 698 children have died so far due to a measles outbreak that started in April, Zimbabwe's health ministry said this weekend. There have been calls by health experts in the country for the enforcement of mandatory vaccination through legislation. The government should run awareness programmes aimed especially at anti-vaccine religious groups, a health expert told AP.

183.title: Bengaluru likely to see heavy rains for next 2-3 days: IMD
183.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has forecast heavy rains in Bengaluru for the next two to three days. The city saw heavy rainfall on Monday, causing severe waterlogging in several parts. Cars and two-wheelers parked in basements or in front of houses were submerged in the rainwater, while boats and tractors evacuated people from flooded areas.

184.title: Trackmen detect rail crack, timely stop train in Maha; mishap averted
184.article_body: A major train accident was averted near Patripul in Thane district of Maharashtra on Tuesday after two trackmen detected a rail fracture and timely stopped an approaching train. Central Railway said trackman Mithun Kumar ran towards Indrayani Express with a red signal and timely stopped the train, while trackman Heera Lal protected the site. "Their work is appreciable," it added.

185.title: Sushmita shares throwback pic with Mother Teresa on her death anniversary
185.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen, taking to her Instagram Stories, re-posted an old black-and-white picture of herself with Mother Teresa on the latter's 25th death anniversary. The original photo was shared by a fan account on Instagram with the caption, "Homage to Mother Teresa on her 25th death anniversary...Mother with @sushmitasen47." Re-sharing the photo, Sushmita added folded hands emoji.

186.title: 1 killed in clash after Israel razes Palestinian attacker's home
186.article_body: A Palestinian man was shot dead by Israeli troops during a clash that erupted in West Bank's Jenin on Tuesday, as per the Palestinian Health Ministry. The ministry added that 16 others were injured in the fighting. The violence broke out after Israeli military demolished the home of a Palestinian who killed three Israelis in an attack earlier this year.

187.title: Govt to onboard all states on National Single Window System by Mar 2023
187.article_body: Government is planning to bring onboard all states that aren't a part of the National Single Window System (NSWS) by March 2023, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade said. NSWS seeks to be the one-stop digital platform to obtain all requisite central and state approvals required to start business operations. About 15 states have reportedly integrated with NSWS.

188.title: MP teacher hits 8-yr-old with iron rod for not finishing homework
188.article_body: A tuition teacher allegedly hit an eight-year-old student with an iron rod for not completing his homework in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior, police said on Tuesday. A case has been registered against the teacher, according to SP Amit Sanghi. The boy sustained injuries to his legs and back, Sanghi said, adding that further legal steps will be taken after an investigation.

189.title: Tahir Raj Bhasin remembers Sushant as 'Chhichhore' completes 3 yrs
189.article_body: Actor Tahir Raj Bhasin took to Instagram on Tuesday to share a post marking three years of his film 'Chhichhore'. "Living...college campus life as Derek was a...mad ride that came with its moments of insane fun," he wrote while sharing some old pictures from sets. "#RememberingSSR (Sushant Singh Rajput) without whom this story would never have been told," Tahir added.

190.title: Binance to convert users' deposits of some coins into its own stablecoins
190.article_body: The world's largest crypto exchange Binance on Monday said it'll automatically convert its users' balances and new deposits of stablecoins USD Coin, Pax Dollar and True USD into its own stablecoin named 'Binance USD'. This is intended to enhance liquidity and capital efficiency for users, Binance said. It added that it'll also stop trading on spot pairs of these coins.

191.title: Ravindra Jadeja undergoes knee surgery, shares pics from hospital
191.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took to Instagram to share that his knee surgery was successful. Sharing pictures, he wrote, "There are many people to thank for their support and involvement: BCCI, my teammates, support staff, physios, doctors and the fans." He added, "I'll start my rehab soon and try to get back to cricket soon as I can."

192.title: Stones pelted as row erupts among Army aspirants over running in MP
192.article_body: A clash erupted between two groups of Army aspirants following a dispute over running in the Bhimrao Ambedkar Stadium in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district. A video showed men pelting stones at each other, while some were also seen brandishing wooden sticks on a racing track. Gunfire was also reported from the stadium. At least four people were injured.

193.title: Rohit Sharma's 73-metre six hits security guard's back, video goes viral
193.article_body: A video showing India captain Rohit Sharma's 73-metre six hitting a security guard's back has gone viral. Rohit slammed the six off Sri Lanka's Asitha Fernando in 10th over. "Doctor: What seems to be the problem? Security guard: I can't sit down. Doctor: Why's that? SG: I took a Rohit Sharma six directly in the a**," a fan jokingly tweeted.

194.title: Will soon fine those who don't wear seat belts in cars' back seats: Gadkari
194.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said that his ministry will notify a fine for not wearing seat belts in the back seats of cars, within the next three days. He added, "Because of the Cyrus Mistry accident, I've decided that in rear seats there will be an alarm for seat belt like it is for driver seats."

195.title: Video shows glass filled with water remaining stable as Vande Bharat train runs at 180 kmph
195.article_body: The new Vande Bharat Express held trial run with the train clocking a speed of over 180 kmph. Southern Railway shared a video and praised the stability inside the coaches even when it's running at high speed. Visuals from inside the train showed a glass filled to the brim with water not shaking as the train speeds at 180 kmph.

196.title: UP Police bust currency trading fraud of ₹15 crore; 1 person arrested
196.article_body: UP Police on Tuesday said they have busted a currency trading fraud involving fake demat accounts. Around 500 such accounts were created and people were cheated of approximately ₹15 crore by a gang whose key member has been arrested from MP's Dewas, police said. The gang had reportedly opened an office by the name 'Amdani Solution' in Indore.

197.title: Brazil fines Apple ₹19 crore, orders it to stop selling iPhones without a battery charger
197.article_body: The Brazilian government on Tuesday ordered Apple to stop selling iPhones without a battery charger in the country. It claimed that the company provides an incomplete product to consumers. The Brazilian Justice Ministry fined Apple 12.275 million reais (around ₹19 crore) and also ordered the cancellation of the sale of the iPhone 12 and newer models.

198.title: JP Nadda, Amit Shah meet in Delhi to plan for 2024 polls
198.article_body: Senior BJP leaders JP Nadda and Amit Shah arrived at the party headquarters in New Delhi on Tuesday for a meeting to focus on the 2024 general elections. Union Ministers Piyush Goyal, Bhupender Yadav, Smriti Irani, Anurag Thakur and Jyotiraditya Scindia would likely attend the meeting. Meanwhile, another set of BJP leaders is travelling to assembly segments to make assessments.

199.title: Chandigarh-Manali highway closed due to landslide, traffic affected
199.article_body: The Chandigarh-Manali highway was closed near the Pandoh area in Himachal Pradesh due to a landslide that occurred during the road widening work on Tuesday. No person was injured in the incident, the Mandi Superintendent of Police said. The vehicular traffic was diverted via the Katola route to Manali, the officer added.

200.title: Fake currency racket busted in Assam's Nagaon; 4 held, currency seized
200.article_body: A fake currency racket was busted in Assam's Nagaon and four persons were arrested in connection with the case, police said on Tuesday. The officials recovered fake notes valuing around ₹20 lakh, two note-making machines and one piece of fake gold from the spot. "They (the accused) cheated people by using fake gold and fake currency notes," police said.

201.title: Himachal CM inaugurates 55 projects worth ₹335 cr in Kangra
201.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh, CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday inaugurated 55 development projects worth ₹335 crore in Kangra. Addressing a public meeting in Nagrota Bagwan, Thakur said the state government has ensured a balanced and all-round development of the state. "The present government is spending...₹1,300 crore annually on providing social security pensions," Thakur said.

202.title: Thieves steal valuables worth ₹27 lakh from Bihar house; video surfaces
202.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing some thieves stealing from a doctor couple's house in Bihar's Darbhanga. The thieves, who were reportedly present inside the house for around three hours, stole valuables worth around ₹27 lakh, including gold and silver jewellery. As seen in the video, the accused were armed with slingshots and they had tied slippers around their waists.

203.title: Cong suffering from nepotism, groupism: Ex-Guj youth Cong chief
203.article_body: Former Gujarat Youth Congress president Vishwanathsinh Vaghela joined BJP on Tuesday, days after quitting his post. Vaghela said that many youth leaders in Congress were unhappy because of "groupism" and "nepotism". Congress gives no direction to its youth, who want to do something for the country and the state, alleged Vaghela.

204.title: Poisonous ants force villagers in Odisha's Puri district to flee
204.article_body: An operation was launched in Brahmansahi village of Odisha's Puri district after lakhs of poisonous red and fire ants attacked the area. After flood waters receded, swarms of ants infested every nook and corner of the village leading to villagers fleeing the area. Locals say they are forced to draw circles with pesticide powder wherever they sit, stand or sleep.

205.title: Moved into a higher orbit: Jaishankar on India-Australia ties
205.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said concerns about regional stability have led to growing convergence between India and Australia. Speaking at the Australia-India Leadership Dialogue 2022, Jaishankar said the ties have now "shifted gears and moved into a higher orbit". He said both countries' participation in the Quadrilateral Security Dialogue will benefit the region.

206.title: Virat Kohli records his most ducks in T20 cricket in a calendar year
206.article_body: Team India batter Virat Kohli got out for a duck off four deliveries against Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match today. It is Kohli's fourth duck in T20 cricket, including international and IPL matches, this year, the most for him in a calendar year. Kohli had recorded three ducks in T20 cricket in 2014.

207.title: I-T refunds worth ₹1.14 lakh crore issued between April-Aug 2022
207.article_body: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued refunds worth ₹1.14 lakh crore to over 1.97 crore taxpayers between April 1, 2022, to August 31, 2022, the department said. A total of ₹61,252 crore has been issued as income tax refunds in 1.96 crore individual cases. Meanwhile, corporate tax refunds of ₹53,158 crore have been issued in 1,46,871 cases.

208.title: India, B'desh must jointly face forces attacking our trust: PM Modi
208.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said India and Bangladesh need to jointly face terrorist and fundamentalist forces threatening to attack mutual trust. Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina is visiting India where she held bilateral talks with PM Modi. Other than discussing the Teesta water sharing agreement, the two countries have signed seven MOUs, including one on sharing of waters of the Kushiyara river.

209.title: Amazon drivers in Japan protest against long hours, excessive deliveries
209.article_body: A group of 15 subcontracted drivers working for Amazon in Japan's Nagasaki is protesting long hours and excessive number of deliveries assigned to them in absence of overtime pay. The group blamed Amazon's AI algorithms for setting impossible deadlines and routes for the drivers, thereby exacerbating their plight. The group formed a union this week and joined drivers in Yokosuka.

210.title: MIT develops new AI model to successfully detect Parkinson’s disease
210.article_body: MIT researchers have developed an AI model that can successfully detect Parkinson's disease from nocturnal breathing patterns. It uses a device that detects breathing patterns in a contactless manner using radio waves. The model also estimated the severity and progression of the disease. Parkinson's is usually diagnosed from symptoms like tremors and slowness that appear years after its onset.

211.title: Actor Kamaal R Khan gets bail in actress molestation case
211.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan was granted bail by a Mumbai court on Tuesday in connection with a molestation case filed against him by an actress. He is already in judicial custody for his alleged derogatory tweets on actor Akshay Kumar's movie 'Laxmii'. The matter will be heard by a magistrate court in Borivali on Wednesday.

212.title: India provides best investment opportunity: Piyush Goyal
212.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Monday said that India provides the best investment opportunity. "It's a destination you cannot miss. It is a market of a billion plus aspirations," he said. Inviting US businesses to invest in India, Goyal said the time is just ripe for "all of us to engage in areas of mutual interest."

213.title: Kartikeya's men threatening to kill my husband: Raju Singh's wife
213.article_body: Raju Singh's wife, Divya Singh, has said that former Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh's relative has issued a threat to her husband and family members. "Alok Singh, his relative, said Raju Singh will be killed if he doesn't compromise in the case. We are scared, we can be killed anytime," she said, in a letter to the CJI of Patna HC.

214.title: SoftBank Vision Fund plans $35 mn investment in GoMechanic: Report
214.article_body: SoftBank Group's Vision Fund is looking to invest $35 million in car service and repair startup GoMechanic, according to a report. Vision Fund's talks with GoMechanic are being held at a valuation of  $600-700 million. GoMechanic was valued at $300 million last year. SoftBank has been in talks with the startup for the last nine months, the report added.

215.title: Fintech startup GroMo raises $11 million in Series A round
215.article_body: Fintech platform GroMo has secured $11 million in Series A funding round led by SIG Venture Capital. The funding round also saw participation of Y Combinator, Goodwater Capital, Beyond Next Ventures, Soma Capital, ACE & Company and Hauz Khas Ventures. The startup also received funds from angel investors including CRED Founder Kunal Shah, Uni Cards CEO Nitin Gupta.

216.title: Locals demolish Assam madrasa after imam's arrest on terror charges
216.article_body: Residents of Darogar Alga in Assam's Goalpara district demolished a private madrasa after its imam was arrested for alleged links to a Bangladesh-based terror outfit. Earlier, authorities had demolished private madrasas in three districts after functionaries were arrested on terror charges. Police claim the Darogar Alga imam also engaged two cadres from the terror group as teachers in the madrasa.

217.title: Video shows BMW, Bentley & other luxury cars submerged in water in Bengaluru
217.article_body: Videos showing luxury cars worth crores submerged in water amid flooding in an upscale area of Bengaluru have been widely shared online. One of the videos showed a tractor carrying people on a flooded road passing by submerged Lexus, Bentley and BMW models worth crores. Some pictures have also shown villas in Yemalur being flooded.

218.title: 4 dead, 8 injured after roof of house collapses in UP's Prayagraj
218.article_body: Four people were killed and eight others sustained injuries after the roof of a house collapsed in Mutthi Ganj in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Tuesday, police said. CM Yogi Adityanath has condoled the deaths and directed officials to provide free treatment to the injured persons. He also announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the victims.

219.title: Frank Drake, who led search for life on other planets, dies aged 92
219.article_body: Frank Drake, the American radio astronomer, who led the search for life on other planets, died aged 92 on September 2 at his home in California. Founder of Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI), Drake also developed Drake Equation, used to estimate the number of advanced civilizations in the galaxy. He was the former dean of science at University of California.

220.title: Lucknow hotel owners sent to 14-day judicial custody after fire kills 4
220.article_body: The owners and general manager of the Levana Hotel in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, where a fire claimed four lives on Monday, were arrested and sent to 14-day judicial custody on Tuesday. Officials earlier said that the hotel will be sealed and demolished as there was no approved map of the hotel building. The cause of the fire isn't known yet.

221.title: 'Fabulous...' is cringy, far from being intellectually stimulating: Johar
221.article_body: Karan Johar, producer of 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', in an Instagram post congratulated Seema Sajdeh, Maheep Kapoor, Bhavana Pandey and Neelam Kothari on the show's success. "Of course it's cringy...Of course, it's far from being intellectually stimulating," Johar wrote, adding that "these girls" have "guts to put themselves out there" knowing fully well that people may laugh at them.

222.title: KL can score at a 150-160 strike rate against best bowlers: Watson
222.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that Indian batter KL Rahul "can score at a 150-160 strike rate against the best bowlers in the world". "When Rahul finds his feet and knows what the conditions are, he really takes down the bowlers...And he's only 30. He's still got three-five years at his absolute prime at the international level," Watson said.

223.title: I thought he didn't like me: Rashmika recalls 1st meeting with Big B
223.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna, recalling her first meeting with 'Goodbye' co-star Amitabh Bachchan, said, "I was waiting for sir on...set and said hi to him. He walked in...and went." "Then I went on...set...I introduced myself. Initially, I thought he didn't like me," she said, adding, "But...one day he...posted a poster of me from Pushpa. I think our relationship...got closer throughout...making of...film."

224.title: Kids unsafe, give us custody: Family of Indian woman who died by suicide in US
224.article_body: The family of Mandeep Kaur, the Indian-origin woman who died by suicide in US after suffering eight years of domestic abuse, is pushing for her two minor daughters' custody. "We've appealed the Indian government to send the children back to India and give us custody. Our priority is the children because they're currently not in safe hands," Kaur's brother said.

225.title: Moody's retains India's rating days after cutting its growth forecast
225.article_body: Moody's Investors Service has retained India's sovereign rating at 'Baa3' with a stable outlook. "The...outlook reflects...the risks from negative feedback between the economy and financial system are receding," it said. Global challenges are unlikely to derail India's economic recovery from the pandemic, it added. This comes after Moody's cut India's economic growth projection to 7.7% for 2022.

226.title: Hatred against Hindus: NIA chargesheet on Bajrang Dal activist's murder
226.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday filed a chargesheet over Bajrang Dal activist Harsha Jingade's killing in Karnataka. According to the chargesheet, the accused persons "conspired to create terror among people of Hindu community". "Accused persons developed hatred against the Hindu community...over issues like CAA-NRC protests, hijab row and cow protection activities," it added.

227.title: Gas supply to Europe depends on Siemens fixing equipment: Gazprom
227.article_body: A senior executive of Russia's state-run gas company Gazprom on Tuesday said that gas supply to Europe via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline would remain suspended until faulty equipment is repaired by Siemens Energy. Meanwhile, the Munich-based Siemens Energy said that the problem described by Gazprom did not constitute a reason to keep the gas pipeline out of operation.

228.title: It's a sham: RCP Singh on Bihar CM's efforts to unite Opposition
228.article_body: Former Union Minister RCP Singh on Tuesday said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's efforts to unite the Opposition against BJP for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were a sham. Singh said Kumar's efforts were a ploy to deflect attention from Bihar's core issues. Opposition unity is quite like "unity of birds" who could fly in different directions, he added.

229.title: Minor arrested for raping 16-yr-old girl in Jharkhand's Khunti
229.article_body: A minor boy was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping a 16-year-old girl in Jharkhand's Khunti, police said. The incident came to light after the victim was found to be four months pregnant, Khunti SP Aman Kumar said. According to the girl's statement, the accused met her outside her school, took her to a secluded place and raped her.

230.title: You still have lot of cricket left in you: CM Yogi to Suresh Raina
230.article_body: After cricketer Suresh Raina announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, UP CM Yogi Adityanath congratulated him by saying that the "whole Uttar Pradesh is proud" of him. "Despite you announcing retirement today...still, I feel that you have a lot of 'cricket' left in you," CM Yogi tweeted. He added, "Best wishes for the new innings of your life."

231.title: Cong will defeat BJP, BJD in 2024 Odisha elections: Sarat Patnaik
231.article_body: The Congress will defeat both BJP and BJD in 2024 elections in the state, Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee (OPCC) President Sarat Patnaik said. Criticising the BJD and BJP alliance, he said that they are supporting each other just to rule the state. "Odisha is still poor and people are going to other states in search of jobs," Patnaik said.

232.title: Perform or face election: DK Shivakumar to K'taka CM amid B'luru rains
232.article_body: After Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai blamed previous Congress governments' 'maladministration' amid Bengaluru's rains, Congress State President DK Shivakumar on Tuesday asked Bommai's administration to perform or face election. Criticising the CM, Shivakumar said, "It is because of your corruption and corruption by your officials." Such a situation had never arisen during Congress' tenure, he said.

233.title: 25-yr-old man's body found hanging in hotel room in UP's Firozabad
233.article_body: A man's body was found hanging in a hotel room located in the Jain Nagar area of Firozabad, Uttar Pradesh. The deceased, Akash (25), reached the hotel on Monday evening, police said. When Akash did not come out of his booked room on the following day, the hotel staff broke the door and found him hanging, police added.

234.title: 2 students abducted near Kolkata's Salt Lake found dead; 4 arrested
234.article_body: At least four persons have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping two school students near Kolkata's Salt Lake area and killing them, police said. The victims, Atanu Dey and Abhishek Naskar, were possibly murdered for a monetary dispute of ₹50,000. The victims were strangulated and their bodies were recovered by police today from a roadside ditch in Basanti, South 24 Parganas.

235.title: Earthquake death toll rises to 65 in China, over 50,000 relocated
235.article_body: The death toll from the 6.8-magnitude earthquake that struck southwestern China's Sichuan province on Monday has risen to 65. More than 50,000 people have been relocated to safer places following damage to buildings. The earthquake caused nearly 240 houses to collapse, Reuters reported. This is said to be the strongest earthquake to hit the Sichuan province since 2017.

236.title: India announce their playing XI for match against Sri Lanka
236.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka won the toss and elected to bowl first in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India have included all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin in their playing XI in place of leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi. India are currently placed third on the Super 4 points table, while Sri Lanka are on top of the table.

237.title: Raj CM drinks holy water with mask on at temple; video surfaces
237.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot drinking Charanamrit (holy water) while wearing his mask at a temple in Jaisalmer. Gehlot was seen performing some religious rituals at the temple, following which he was offered the holy water. As per reports, Gehlot was greeted at the temple with chants hailing Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

238.title: Congrats Young King, you earned it: James on Tiafoe's win vs Nadal at US Open
238.article_body: Following American Frances Tiafoe's fourth round win against 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal at US Open 2022, Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James tweeted, "Congrats Young King!!! You earned it!" Chris Evert said, "Much respect for this guy Tiafoe. A well deserved win over a great champion Nadal." Tiafoe has reached the US Open quarter-final for the first time.

239.title: Crypto assets now being used as tools of speculative investment: IMF report
239.article_body: A report written by IMF's Assistant Director Marina Moretti and Deputy Director Aditya Narain has said that crypto assets are no longer "niche goods". They're now being used for speculative investments, hedges against weak currencies and payment instruments, the report said. Failures of crypto issuers and exchanges have "added pressure to the call for regulation", the report added.

240.title: Ganesh utsav samithi members arrested amid idol immersion row in Hyd
240.article_body: Bhagyanagar Ganesh Utsav Samithi members on Tuesday tried taking out a bike rally in Hyderabad to oppose the restrictions imposed on the immersion of Plaster of Paris-made idols of Lord Ganesha in Hussain Sagar lake. Since there was no permission for the rally, police took all the protesters, including the committee's General Secretary Bhagavanth Rao, into preventive custody.

241.title: Faridabad residents protest over proposed cutting of mini-forest
241.article_body: Faridabad residents staged a protest against the proposed construction of a cycle track that is likely to compromise a portion of a mini-forest developed by local youth and school students. Around 100 residents gathered at the Lal Bahadur Shastri Chowk in Sector 15. "Building a cycle track at the cost of...trees is an exercise in futility," a protestor said.

242.title: BJP, original Shiv Sena will fight, win Mumbai's BMC polls: Fadnavis
242.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said that BJP, along with the original Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena) will fight and win the upcoming BMC polls in Mumbai. Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said, "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed the BJP after seeking votes on the names of Narendra Modi and Devendra Fadnavis.

243.title: Shrikant Tyagi's wife seeks protection for him citing threat
243.article_body: Anu Tyagi, the wife of jailed politician Shrikant Tyagi, has moved a Noida court to get protection for her husband during appearances in court. Tyagi, who has been in judicial custody for nearly a month, was arrested on August 9 from Meerut for allegedly assaulting a woman in Noida. Tyagi’s wife claimed there is a threat from history-sheeter Vinay Tyagi.

244.title: My uncle used to drape me in a saree and sexually abuse me when I was 8: Rohit Verma
244.article_body: Designer Rohit Verma, in a recent interview, revealed that he was raped during his childhood days. "My uncle used to drape me in a saree, put hot wax on me and [sexually abuse me] at the age of 8," said Verma. "I was horrified to tell my mother, he said 'Nobody will believe you'," the designer added.

245.title: 36-year-old rapper Pat Stay stabbed to death in Canada
245.article_body: Canadian rapper Pat Stay passed away aged 36 after being stabbed to death in Nova Scotia's Halifax. An autopsy performed by the Nova Scotia Medical Examiner Service determined Stay's manner of death was homicide, police said. Condoling Pat's demise, Eminem tweeted, "Hip hop lost one of the best battlers of all time...RIP @patstay...KINGS NEVER DIE."

246.title: Before & after satellite pics show impact of Europe's worst drought in 500 years
246.article_body: Some satellite pictures have shown how the devastating drought in Europe has affected its green areas. The images shared by the Copernicus Programme of the European Union, captured by its Sentinel satellite, have shown that large parts turned brown between July 1 and August 31. Experts believe the ongoing drought is the continent's worst drought in 500 years.

247.title: Paytm disbursed 6 mn loans in Jul-Aug, up 246% from last year
247.article_body: Payments aggregator Paytm said that it disbursed 6 million loans in July and August in 2022, up 246% from the same period last year. It stated that the total value of these loans rose 484% to ₹4,527 crore. Paytm also added that its total gross merchandise value (GMV) increased to ₹2.10 lakh crore, up 72% from last year.

248.title: 20-year-old biker dies after being hit by state-run bus in Hyderabad
248.article_body: A 20-year-old man died after being hit by a state-run bus in Bahadurpura, Hyderabad, on Monday. Syed Shoiebuddin, a resident of Falaknuma, was travelling on a bike from Tadban crossroads towards Bahadurpura when the bus hit his bike. Locals raised slogans against Telangana State Road Transport Corporation following the accident. Police seized the bus and took the driver into custody.

249.title: Railways to run extra late night trains in Mumbai for Ganesha immersion
249.article_body: Keeping in mind the extra rush of passengers as part of the culmination of Ganeshotsav in Mumbai, the Railways have announced that more local trains will run on September 9 and 10. According to the Central Railway Public Relations Office, 10 additional trains will serve on both days, which will halt at all stations.

250.title: Will give necessary stimulus to economy along with RBI: Sitharaman
250.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said the government and RBI will together give necessary stimulus to economy. She said, "Together with a central bank, the finance ministry...will be working out a pathway, which will be predictable...and give every stimulus required for the growth of the Indian economy." The government is committed to the announced plan for bank privatisation, she added.

251.title: How can India still qualify for the Asia Cup 2022 final?
251.article_body: India are third on Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 points table with NRR of -0.126. India will reach final if they win both their games (against Sri Lanka and Afghanistan) and Pakistan defeat Sri Lanka. If Sri Lanka defeat Pakistan and India win their remaining games, then India would've to win with big margins as NRR will decide their fate.

252.title: Pakistani Rangers break ceasefire, open fire on BSF troops at J&K border
252.article_body: Pakistani Rangers violated the ceasefire on Tuesday and opened fire at the Border Security Force (BSF) troops along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir, a BSF official said. "The alert BSF...troops gave a befitting reply to the unprovoked firing," he added. India and Pakistan had agreed to a ceasefire along Jammu and Kashmir borders on February 20, 2021.

253.title: Pub operating as illegal dance bar raided in B'luru, ₹1.8 lakh seized
253.article_body: Bengaluru City Crime Branch officers conducted a raid at a local pub in the Royal Orchid Hotel, police said on Monday. They arrested seven staffers and seized ₹1.8 lakh from Jeff's bar after discovering that the management converted the pub into an illegal dance bar and operated beyond permissible hours. The incident occurred within Jeevan Bhima Nagar Police Station limits.

254.title: Amit Sadh turns down alcohol brand ad, says 'can't hurt fans'
254.article_body: Amit Sadh recently turned down an alcohol brand endorsement because he didn't want to upset his fans. "I work for my fans and my audience. I cannot work on something that will hurt their sentiments or is likely to cause any kind of harm," he said. He added he is "utterly against" promoting anything that can develop an unhealthy habit.

255.title: BJP workers stage protest against AAP govt, detained by Delhi Police
255.article_body: The Delhi Police detained BJP workers, who were protesting against Arvind Kejriwal-led government over the city's excise policy case on Tuesday. Several BJP leaders staged a protest outside Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence and demanded his resignation over his alleged involvement in the excise policy scam. BJP won't rest until Sisodia is removed, said Ramvir Singh Bidhuri.

256.title: 25-yr-old man rapes 27-yr-old sister-in-law in Gurugram, arrested
256.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly raping his sister-in-law in Gurugram, police said. The woman, in her complaint, alleged that the incident took place on August 28, when her husband wasn't at home. I hadn't locked the door of my room that night because of which he barged in and raped me, the woman said.

257.title: Always picked script based on my gut feel: Actress Rashmika
257.article_body: Rashmika Mandanna, who will be seen in Amitabh Bachchan's 'Goodbye', said she "always picked a script based on my gut feel". The actress said she wants to be part of good films and keep working till she feels happy about it. When asked what she would like to say goodbye to, Rashmika replied, "Negativity around us or anyone".

258.title: 19-year-old Alcaraz enters 2nd straight quarter-final at US Open
258.article_body: World number four Carlos Alcaraz reached his second successive quarter-final at US Open after defeating 2014 champion Marin Cilic 6-4, 3-6, 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 in the fourth round. The 19-year-old won the match, which finished at 2:23 am on Tuesday in New York, in three hours 54 minutes. It was the fourth-latest finish in tournament history.

259.title: Delhi HC grants bail to 3 accused in Biocon bribery case
259.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday gave bail to three accused in the Biocon bribery case which is being investigated by the CBI. Former Joint drug controller in Drug Controller General of India S Eswara Reddy was among the ones to get bail. The CBI arrested Reddy in June after he was allegedly caught with a bribe of ₹4 lakh.

260.title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal to tie the knot by September end: Reports
260.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal are reportedly getting married by September end. Their wedding will be a private affair, which will be held over five days. As per reports, Ali and Richa will also be hosting a reception in Delhi and Mumbai. The couple had planned to get married in 2020, but it got postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

261.title: Hyderabad man gets message saying he's won KBC lottery, loses ₹3,03,000
261.article_body: A man lost ₹3,03,000 by a fraudster who was posing as the Kaun Banega Crorepati lottery. The 27-year-old victim had received a WhatsApp message informing him that he had won ₹25 lakh. He then got call from a man who requested his bank details and said he would need to pay money for approval from Delhi chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

262.title: 'Chup' is an ode to art and spirit of artistes: Shreya Dhanwanthary
262.article_body: Shreya Dhanwanthary described her upcoming R Balki film, titled 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist', as "an ode to art and the spirit of every artiste". She said that while the film pays tribute to the late legendary actor-director Guru Dutt, it "quintessentially respects the lives and the work of artists across all quarters". She also called Balki "a maverick".

263.title: Congress leader floats on waterlogged B'luru road to protest against govt
263.article_body: Karnataka Pradesh Youth Congress Committee President Mohammed Haris Nalapad waded through a waterlogged road in Bengaluru to protest against the Karnataka government. He demanded a solution to the severe waterlogging after heavy rains in the city. A video shows Nalapad sitting on an inflated rubber tube and his supporters walking in knee-deep water.

264.title: Noida Police inspect fire safety arrangements in 43 buildings
264.article_body: Noida Police, in coordination with fire department officials, inspected 43 buildings in the city for fire safety arrangements. In total, 16 schools, 15 hospitals and 12 hotels were inspected. The inspections were carried out hours after a fire tragedy at a hotel in Lucknow killed four people on Monday morning.

265.title: Sembcorp to sell 2 power plants in India to Oman's Tanweer Infra for ₹11,700 cr
265.article_body: Singapore-based Sembcorp Industries will sell two of its power plants in India to Oman's Tanweer Infrastructure for ₹11,700 crore. The two power plants are located in Andhra Pradesh and have a combined capacity of 2.6 GW. The move to sell its holding in Sembcorp Energy India is in line with the company's strategy to migrate from brown to green energy.

266.title: Beautiful & blessed: Suriya on completing 25 yrs in film industry
266.article_body: Tamil actor Suriya Sivakumar has completed 25 years in the film industry. On Tuesday, the actor took to Twitter to celebrate the milestone and tweeted, "Truly a beautiful and blessed 25 years. Dream and believe." Suriya, who made his debut with the 1997 release 'Nerukku Ner', has acted in around 50 films so far.

267.title: Revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore released to 14 states
267.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday released the sixth instalment of the Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, totalling ₹7,183 crore. The PDRD grants, released as per the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission, are given to the states under Article 275 of the Constitution to meet the gap in revenue accounts of the states post devolution.

268.title: 2 Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists killed in encounter in J&K
268.article_body: Two Hizbul Mujahideen terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Poshkreeri area of J&K's Anantnag on Tuesday. Following a tip-off, a cordon-and-search operation was launched by security forces. "Both were involved in...killing of one Territorial Army personnel Saleem on April 9, 2021, and killing of two civilians on May 29, 2021, in Jablipora," said ADGP Kashmir.

269.title: Female US news anchor suffers stroke on live TV, video surfaces
269.article_body: A US news anchor was seen fumbling her words and stopping mid-sentences while reading a news report live on air as she started to show early signs of a stroke. Julie Chin suffered the "beginnings of a stroke" on TV on September 3. She said during the broadcast, "I'm sorry, something's going on with me this morning...I apologise to everybody."

270.title: PWD issues flood alert along Cauvery river banks in TN's Salem
270.article_body: Public Works Department officials on Tuesday raised a flood alert in Tamil Nadu's Salem. As PWD decided to discharge surplus water from Stanley reservoir in Mettur dam in Salem, it asked people living on the banks of the Cauvery river to move to safer places. Mettur dam is receiving water from Karnataka, which has been experiencing heavy rains since Sunday.

271.title: K'taka govt proposes sluice gates for B'luru lakes to prevent flooding
271.article_body: The Karnataka government is considering the construction of sluice gates for all Bengaluru lakes to regulate water overflow during heavy rains and to prevent flooding in catchments around lakes. Several parts of the city are waterlogged after heavy rainfall. "This was the highest rainfall in the last 42 years," CM Basavaraj Bommai said.

272.title: For God's sake, stop trolling Arshdeep, we should support our team: Ayushmann
272.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana took to Instagram and defended pacer Arshdeep Singh who was trolled for dropping a catch during India versus Pakistan Asia Cup match on Sunday. "For God's sake, stop trolling Arshdeep. He's a great prospect," he wrote, adding, "Let's not be fickle and fair weather. We should support our team even when they lose a close one."

273.title: 97% of Puneites willing to buy EVs to fight air pollution: Survey
273.article_body: A survey by Clean Mobility Collective, India, has found that around 97.2% of respondents in Pune were willing to buy electric vehicles to fight air pollution and mitigate climate change. According to the survey, 84.5% of respondents attributed last-mile delivery vehicles as one of the reasons for rising air pollution in the cities. The survey was conducted among 1,508 respondents.

274.title: Fire breaks out at private buses workshop in Gurugram, 3 buses burnt
274.article_body: As many as three buses were gutted in a fire that broke out at a private buses workshop in Gurugram. The fire also affected the slum areas which were near the workshop. Firefighters, along with two fire engines, were rushed to the spot and it was brought under control. We controlled the fire quickly, said Dinesh Kumar, a fire officer.

275.title: Russia's VTB Bank launches transfers in Chinese yuan bypassing SWIFT
275.article_body: VTB Bank on Tuesday said it has become the first Russian bank to launch money transfers to China in yuan without using the international messaging system SWIFT. Western countries had cut-off Russian banks from SWIFT in March over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Maximum amount of a single money transfer is equivalent to 20 million roubles (approx $3,28,677), VTB Bank said.

276.title: Liz Truss officially takes over as UK PM
276.article_body: Liz Truss officially took over as UK's new Prime Minister on Tuesday after meeting Queen Elizabeth at Balmoral Castle. Truss, who defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race, is the third woman Prime Minister of the United Kingdom after Margaret Thatcher and Theresa May. Earlier, Boris Johnson tendered his resignation to the Queen at the Balmoral Castle.

277.title: Highest corruption allegations in T'gana: BJP MP on KCR's free electricity remark
277.article_body: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced "free power supply to all farmers in the country if non-BJP government comes to power in 2024", BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri criticised KCR. "Highest corruption allegations are in Telangana," Dharmapuri said.  "They said they'll give free 24/7 electricity to farmers, but the power supply is only for 7-8 hours," he added.

278.title: 3 killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, region's guv says
278.article_body: Three civilians were killed by Russian shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv region in the last 24 hours, the region's governor said on Tuesday. The strikes destroyed a private residential building in Kharkiv city, killing a 73-year-old woman, the official informed. The remaining casualties were reported in a village north of Kharkiv where two men reportedly died amid shelling.

279.title: 3 Naxalites, including a woman, surrender in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
279.article_body: Three Naxalites, including a woman, surrendered before the police and Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) in Chhattisgarh's Sukma on Tuesday, police said. The woman, Madkam Hidme, was the vice-president of Jantana Sarkar in Bijapur, while Punem Kanna was a member of the Naxal's doctor committee and Karam Sukku was the vice-president of Peddagalur Jantana Sarkar in Bijapur, an official said.

280.title: She's like a doormat, different from the person I am: Swara on 'Jahaan...' role
280.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said her character in her upcoming movie 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar' is "like a doormat". "Her greatest fear is that her husband will get angry, her pet lines are 'Let me ask him'," she added. "It's very different...from the person I am...I don't remember having to ask for permission to do anything in my life," said Swara.

281.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar meets Arvind Kejriwal in Delhi
281.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the national capital on Tuesday. Taking to Twitter, Kejriwal said that they discussed many serious issues including 'Operation Lotus', horse-trading of MLAs by "these people" to topple elected governments and the increasing corruption of BJP governments. Kumar is in Delhi to unify the Opposition ahead of the 2024 general elections.

282.title: 5 of family killed, 1 injured as car hits electric pole in Ludhiana
282.article_body: Five members of a family were killed and one person was injured after their car crashed into an electric pole in Ludhiana on Tuesday, police said. The accident occurred when they were returning to Ludhiana after attending a family function in Chandigarh. The deceased were identified as 40-year-old Rajesh Kumar, his 5-year-old daughter Jasmine, 30-year-old Sanjna and her two daughters.

283.title: All-rounder for all seasons, welcome to next season of life: Gambhir on Raina
283.article_body: After Suresh Raina announced his retirement from all formats of cricket on Tuesday, ex-India cricketer Gautam Gambhir took to Twitter and wrote, "An all-rounder for all seasons! Welcome to the next season of life!" India opener Shubman Gill tweeted, "Your contribution to the game of cricket is invaluable. Good luck on your second innings Raina bhai."

284.title: Congress shares video of Tejasvi 'enjoying' dosa amid B'luru floods
284.article_body: Congress spokesperson Lavanya Ballal on Tuesday shared a video of BJP MP Tejasvi Surya eating masala dosa at an eatery in Bengaluru. "Surya was enjoying a good breakfast while [Bengaluru] was drowning. Has he visited even a single flood affected region?" Ballal tweeted. "After watching [an Instagram reel], I'm here...to try out this...dosa," Surya was heard saying in the video.

285.title: CISF cover provided to protect RSS offices; bizarre: Jairam
285.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the Centre for allegedly providing armed CISF cover to RSS offices in Delhi. "3000 CISF posts at airports to be abolished and replaced by private security. But CISF [given] to protect 'Humare Do' and RSS facilities," Ramesh said. He added, "Private for public assets and public for private entities. Bizarre!"

286.title: 3 farmers die by suicide in Nagpur in 2 days over crop failure
286.article_body: Three marginal farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Nagpur district in separate incidents due to crop failure and indebtedness in two days, police said. Vitthalrao Umarkar, 62, and Krishna Sayam, 36, were reportedly found hanging in Ambada and Tanda villages of Nagpur district, respectively. Another farmer, Ashok Sarwe, 35, died after allegedly consuming poison in Umri village.

287.title: TN Police forms teams to monitor rumours being spread on social media
287.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police has formed teams to keep a check on those spreading rumours on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook. Comprising 203 police officers, the 'Social Media Committees' will ensure no clashes arise from cast, religious and political animosity. The teams have been formed across nine cities, including Chennai, and 37 districts across the state.

288.title: German Prez asks for forgiveness over 1972 Munich Olympics attacks
288.article_body: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier asked for forgiveness for country's failure to protect 11 Israeli athletes at the 1972 Munich Olympics. "I am ashamed...I ask for forgiveness for insufficient protection of the athletes, for insufficient resolution of this matter," Steinmeier said. A German policeman and five Palestinian gunmen also died during a standoff at the Olympic village.

289.title: Hong Kong reports its first case of monkeypox
289.article_body: Hong Kong reported its first case of monkeypox on Tuesday, health authorities said. A 30-year-old man who arrived in Hong Kong from the Philippines after travelling in the US and Canada showed symptoms of monkeypox. Hong Kong, which has so far not reported any local cases of monkeypox, will now raise the response level for the outbreak to 'alert' level.

290.title: Swiss police find 23 migrants, including Indians, crammed into a van
290.article_body: Switzerland police on Monday found 23 migrants crammed into the windowless cargo area of a delivery van during a traffic check on a highway. The migrants, aged between 20 and 50, were from India, Afghanistan, Syria and Bangladesh, police said, adding that the driver of the van has been arrested. The migrants were trying to travel to other European countries.

291.title: Youth, women to be given priority in ticket distribution for Guj polls: Cong leader
291.article_body: The Congress party will give priority to youth and women in ticket distribution for the Gujarat Assembly polls, party leader Ramesh Chennithala said on Tuesday. "This time, we will give priority to new faces, youth and women in ticket distribution. Our list of candidates for the Gujarat polls this time will be an impressive one," Chennithala said.

292.title: 900 kg of adulterated paneer worth ₹1.98 lakh seized in Pune
292.article_body: Pune Food and Drug Administration (FDA) raided an illegal factory in Manjari Khurd in the city and seized around 900 kilograms of adulterated paneer, estimated to be worth ₹1.98 lakh, an official said. The Assistant Commissioner at the Pune FDA, Sanjay Naragude, said that skimmed milk powder and  RBD Palmolein oil worth ₹2.24 lakh were also seized from the factory.

293.title: Canada extends manhunt to nab suspect in mass stabbing that killed 10
293.article_body: Canada's largest manhunt launched to trace the only surviving suspect involved in a stabbing incident, which led to ten deaths, extended into its third day. Hundreds of police officers are looking for 30-year-old Myles Sanderson, who is reportedly armed and dangerous. Police suspect that Sanderson may have killed his 31-year-old brother Damien, another suspect in the stabbing incident.

294.title: One catch doesn't define a player's role, we're all with Arshdeep: Dhawan
294.article_body: India opener Shikhar Dhawan has tweeted in support of pacer Arshdeep Singh, who was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in the Asia Cup on Sunday. "One catch does not define a player's role...We're all with you Arshdeep. You have a long and glorious career ahead. Go and win India more games. You're unstoppable," wrote Dhawan.

295.title: Nitish Kumar is on political tourism in Delhi: Sushil Modi
295.article_body: Former Deputy CM of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi said that the state's Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is on a political tour in the national capital while the people of Bihar have been facing a flood. "The Lok Sabha election is approaching so Nitish Kumar has come to Delhi on political tourism," the Rajya Sabha MP said.

296.title: Python enters BJP MLA's house during public meeting, video surfaces
296.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a python can be seen entering BJP MLA Rahul Bachha Sonkar's house in UP during a public meeting. In the 8-second video clip, the python can be seen coiling itself near the door of Bilhaur MLA Sonkar's house. After the snake's appearance, Uttar Pradesh Forest Corporation was informed about the incident.

297.title: Viral video appears to show Harry Styles spitting on Chris Pine during film's premiere
297.article_body: The video of an interaction between Harry Styles and Chris Pine at the premiere of 'Don't Worry Darling' has gone viral. In the clip, Styles supposedly "appears to spit" on Pine while taking his assigned seat next to the actor, who then looks down at his lap and stops clapping. However, some viewers have dismissed the spitting claim.

298.title: Pics of 'rainbow ice caves' in US go viral, authorities say they can be 'deadly'
298.article_body: The US National Park Service (NPS) issued an advisory to people visiting Washington's Mount Rainier National Park after a photographer's pictures showing 'rainbow ice caves' there went viral. Officials "strongly discourage" people from entering the caves, the NPS said, adding, "They are prone to spontaneous collapse." It said, "Collapse or ice and rock fall could be fatal."

299.title: Which are the world's 10 most valuable unicorn startups as per Hurun?
299.article_body: TikTok owner Douyin Group (formerly called ByteDance) is the world's most valuable unicorn startup with a valuation of $200 billion, as per Hurun Global Venture Capitalists 2022 Half-Year Report. It is followed by Elon Musk-led SpaceX ($125 billion) and Jack Ma's Ant Group ($120 billion). The list of most valuable unicorns includes Stripe, Shein, Binance, Databricks, WeBank, JDT and Checkout.com.

300.title: Yatra can achieve both 'Bharat jodo', 'Congress jodo': Shashi Tharoor
300.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' could achieve both "Bharat jodo" and "Congress jodo" as it could also unite Congressmen and women across the country around the party's values and ideals as well as service to the people. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is one important contribution to this ongoing effort, he told PTI.

301.title: Siddique Kappan mastermind at evading police: UP govt tells SC
301.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has asked the Supreme Court to reject journalist Siddique Kappan's bail plea. "The accused is a mastermind at evading police," the government said in an affidavit. It accused Kappan of suppressing facts, destroying electronic evidence and propagating activities of the Popular Front of India (PFI) under the garb of journalism.

302.title: Specially-abled man electrocuted by live wire hanging from open box in Thane
302.article_body: A 29-year-old man was electrocuted by a live wire protruding from an open electricity Distribution Point (DP) in Thane on Monday. The incident took place when the deceased, Vijay Bodade, who was sleeping outside the house, woke up and went for a walk. Half asleep, he came in contact with the live wires from the open electricity box and died.

303.title: 6 arrested for attacking Muslim cab driver in Hyderabad
303.article_body: Six people were reportedly arrested after a Muslim cab driver was attacked in Hyderabad. As per reports, a group of unidentified men allegedly forced him to say 'Jai Shree Ram' when he was on his way to pick up a passenger. The man alleged that when he refused to chant 'Jai Shree Ram', they attacked his car with boulders.

304.title: Villagers lock up sarpanch for not holding gram sabha in Maha's Latur
304.article_body: Villagers in Maharashtra's Latur district on Tuesday locked their sarpanch inside the panchayat office for not holding a gram sabha for two and a half years. Datta Gaikwad, sarpanch of Katgaon village, was reportedly released after he promised to hold a gram sabha on Thursday. According to Block Development Officer Tukaram Bhalke, a probe has been initiated into the matter.

305.title: Police detain 35 mafia suspects in hunt for Italy's top fugitive
305.article_body: Italian police have arrested 35 people in a series of raids against suspected mafia members. The operation is part of a broader investigation aimed at capturing Sicilian mafia boss Matteo Denaro, who has been on the run since 1993, police said. Denaro is wanted over the 1992 murders of two anti-mafia prosecutors and 1993 bombings in Florence, Rome and Milan.

306.title: Markets end flat with Sensex down 49 points, Nifty at 17,650
306.article_body: Benchmark indices ended flat on Tuesday amid volatility. Sensex was down 48.99 points to end at 59,196.99, while Nifty lost 10.20 points to close at 17,655.60. Bharti Airtel, NTPC, Apollo Hospitals, Cipla, SBI Life and RIL were the top gainers, while stocks of Tata Consumer Products, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, UPL, Britannia, Kotak Bank and Mahindra & Mahindra slipped.

307.title: Mercedes-Benz launches investigation into accident that killed Mistry
307.article_body: Mercedes-Benz has launched an investigation into the road accident that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and involved one of its GLC cars. A team from Mercedes-Benz visited the accident site and collected the vehicle's data to analyse details such as the car's tyre pressure and brake fluid level. The accident took place in Palghar on Sunday.

308.title: TMC stages dharna against release of convicts in Bilkis Bano rape case
308.article_body: Trinamool Congress' women wing launched a 48-hour-long dharna in Kolkata to protest against the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case. They called the decision shameful and unacceptable. “The law of the country says that when remission is considered for any prisoner, those punished for rape are not to be considered,” said TMC leader Shashi Panja.

309.title: Lufthansa pilots to go on strike again for higher wages: Union
309.article_body: Pilots of the passenger and cargo divisions of the German airline Lufthansa will hold a strike again over a wage dispute, Vereinigung Cockpit (VC) said on Tuesday. The pilots' association VC is demanding a 5.5% rise in pay this year. Passenger pilots will strike on Wednesday and Thursday while cargo pilots will strike from Wednesday to Friday.

310.title: Sisodia lays foundation stone of flyover at Delhi's Sarai Kale Khan
310.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday laid the foundation stone of a three-lane flyover at Sarai Kale Khan to ease traffic movement from ITO to Ashram. "The flyover will be ready in one year," Sisodia added. It'll cause reduction in carbon emissions by five tonnes daily and save ₹19 crore of public money every year, Sisodia further said.

311.title: 80% work of geo-mapping 900 kindergartens in Mumbai completed: BMC
311.article_body:
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) stated around 80% work of geo-mapping Mumbai's 900 kindergartens has been completed. "The survey will help us...identify if there is a need for a nursery school depending on the ward's population," BMC joint commissioner said.
The survey will also help to know if there's proper infrastructure and basic amenities like drinking water and toilets.

312.title: Gold worth PKR 20 mn stolen from Pak jeweller's bag during flight: Report
312.article_body: Gold worth PKR 20 million was stolen from a Pakistani jeweller's cabin baggage during a flight from Dubai to Karachi, a media report said. Mohammad Moonis reportedly lost 1,542 grams of gold on Sunday afternoon. The Airport Security Force (ASF) had conducted a scanning of all passengers after the flight landed in Karachi, but the stolen gold wasn't recovered.

313.title: Sameer Khetarpal appointed as CEO and MD of Jubilant FoodWorks
313.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, the firm that operates fast-food chains like Domino's Pizza and Dunkin' Donuts, appointed Sameer Khetarpal as the new CEO and MD. In a statement, the company said that shareholders have also approved the appointment in the 27th Annual General Meeting. Khetarpal's earlier stint was with Amazon where he scaled businesses like Amazon Fresh, Amazon Foods and Amazon Pharmacy.

314.title: Ayan, Alia, Ranbir to host 'Brahmastra' screening for fans on Sept 8
314.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Alia Bhatt shared a video along with 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji and actor Ranbir Kapoor in a movie theatre. In the video, Alia revealed that they are watching 'Brahmastra' for the first time. Ayan further said that they will hold a special premiere with fans on September 8 and watch the film with the audience.

315.title: Congress govt's 'maladministration' is why B'luru is suffering: CM Bommai
315.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai accused the previous Congress governments in Karnataka for the present situation of Bengaluru. "This happened because of maladministration and totally unplanned administration of previous Congress government. They never thought of maintaining the lakes," he said. Administration is working round the clock to tackle the waterlogging problem, the CM added.

316.title: MP man dresses in wife's clothes to steal ₹1.25 lakh, valuables; arrested
316.article_body: A man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh for allegedly dressing up in his wife's clothes and stealing ₹1.25 lakh and some valuables from another man's house. The CCTV footage showed a man dressed in a woman's clothes. Reports said that the police first suspected it to be a eunuch but later found out that the accused was a man.

317.title: Allow free travel to passengers above 75 in Mumbai's BEST buses: BJP leader
317.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming BMC election, BJP leader Pravin Chheda has written to Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis to allow passengers over 75 years of age to travel for free in Mumbai's BEST buses. "Most senior citizens are dependent. If they are allowed free travel, it will help them," Chheda, who is also a former BEST committee chairman, said.

318.title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank IPO gets fully subscribed on day 2
318.article_body: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's maiden public issue got fully subscribed 1.01 times on Tuesday, the second day of subscription. According to BSE data, the retail category was overbooked 2.11 times, non-institutional investors 0.83 times and qualified institutional bidders 0.73 times as of 10:35 am. The issue size was reduced to 87.12 lakh shares from 1.58 crore shares after anchor book response.

319.title: Male colleagues would 'moo' when I used lactation room: Goldman Sachs ex-MD
319.article_body: Goldman Sachs' former Managing Director Jamie Fiore Higgins revealed she was forced to quit her 17-year-old job in 2016 after facing discrimination at the American bank. Higgins said her male colleagues would 'moo' when she went to the lactation centre. She further said a boss told her she'd never make managing director if she was "pumping milk instead of working".

320.title: If I have choice between Karthik & Pant, then Karthik gets my vote: Manjrekar
320.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said if he had a choice between Dinesh Karthik and Rishabh Pant for the lower-middle order slot, then he would choose Karthik. "There is something Karthik is doing right of late...on current form, I think he gets my vote," stated Manjrekar. "Pant is still searching for that perfect formula to become an impact player," he added.

321.title: Have nothing to hide, did my job honestly: Sisodia amid ED raids
321.article_body: Hours after ED carried out searches in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy case, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said he has nothing to hide and did his job "honestly". If ED officers come to my place, they'll only find maps of some schools, Sisodia added. Notably, around 30 locations across various states including Delhi and Telangana are being raided.

322.title: Priyanka urges people to join Bharat Jodo Yatra, says want to solve problems
322.article_body: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra urged people to join party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is slated to cover a distance of around 3,500 km. “We are starting a positive politics. We want to hear from you, we want to solve your problems. We want to unite our beloved country. Let’s unite India together,” said Priyanka.

323.title: Kejriwal to start nationwide tour for 'Make India No 1' campaign tomorrow
323.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he'll begin his nationwide tour as part of 'Make India No 1' campaign from his birthplace Hisar in Haryana tomorrow. He said that it's the "dream" of 130-crore people to see India become "the best country". However, he said that the country can't progress until every child receives quality education for "free".

324.title: CBI questions TMC MLA Paresh Pal in murder of BJP worker in Kolkata
324.article_body: The CBI questioned TMC MLA Paresh Pal in connection with its investigation into the murder of BJP worker Abhijit Sarkar in post-poll violence in Kolkata. “We have specific questions for Pal in connection with the murder of Sarkar. These questions have been framed after grilling a few others,” a CBI officer said.

325.title: Are citizens lower priority?: Tharoor on armed CISF cover to RSS offices
325.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday questioned the Centre's decision to abolish over 3,000 CISF posts at airports while RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed CISF cover. "So, tax-paying citizens who are passengers in public airports are a lower priority for CISF deployment than a private non-governmental organisation?" Tharoor tweeted.

326.title: Can resolve all problems with PM Modi at helm in India: B'desh PM
326.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India and Bangladesh can resolve all their problems as long as PM Narendra Modi is at the helm. "Our main aim is to develop the economy and fulfil the basic needs of our people. With friendship, you can solve any problem," PM Hasina said.

327.title: 5 of family, including 3 kids, killed as car overturns in Ludhiana
327.article_body: At least five members of a family, including three kids, were killed after the car they were travelling in overturned on the Ludhiana-Chandigarh highway. The accident took place when the driver lost control and the car hit a wall before overturning. Among the deceased, two were aged five, one was aged three, one was aged 35 and another 30.

328.title: DreamFolks shares list at premium, gain 56% from IPO price
328.article_body: DreamFolks Services shares on Tuesday listed at a premium of 56% above their issue price at ₹508 apiece on the NSE from the initial public offering (IPO) price range of ₹308-326. On the BSE, the stock began trading at ₹505 a share, a premium of 54.9%. The ₹562-crore IPO of the airport service aggregator was subscribed 56.7 times last month.

329.title: Taimur, Jeh should respect that woman of the house also works: Kareena
329.article_body: Speaking about Taimur and Jeh, actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said they have to grow to understand that both of their parents work so that they can have a good life. "They should respect that the woman of the house also works. They should know...their mother...goes to work...This is how my boys will have to be brought up," she added.

330.title: Instagram user calls Cobra's screenplay 'confusing', director says 'sorry'
330.article_body: Ajay Gnanamuthu, writer-director of the recently released movie 'Cobra' starring Vikram, responded to an Instagram user who said the film's screenplay was quite confusing. Ajay replied, "Firstly sorry that you felt confused!! But me as an audience I've always liked watching mind-bending films and genuinely tried it this time!! If possible [please] try watching it again hopefully you like it."

331.title: Virat shouldn't say such things in middle of Asia Cup: Madan Lal
331.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's remark that no one texted him except MS Dhoni when he left Test captaincy, ex-India all-rounder Madan Lal said that the 33-year-old shouldn't make such comments in the middle of the Asia Cup. "Even if someone calls or doesn't call, if you're in trouble you have to work on it...Ego shouldn't clash here," stated Lal.

332.title: Greta criticises Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis during polls
332.article_body: Climate activist Greta Thunberg criticised Swedish politicians for ignoring climate crisis before September 11 election. Thunberg pointed out that the issue had been "pretty much non-existent...we have been completely focusing on other things" during the election campaign. She cited Pakistan's example, where monsoon rains and melting glaciers triggered floods, affecting 33 million people.

333.title: 5 Shiv Sena workers tear down BJP banners in Mumbai, booked
333.article_body: The Mumbai Police have registered a case against five Shiv Sena workers for allegedly tearing down banners put up by BJP workers in the Lower Parel area of the city, officials said on Tuesday. BJP workers had put up the banners in the run-up to the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections and the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

334.title: India adopted leadership role in fight against climate change: Union Minister
334.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Tuesday said India has adopted a leadership role in the fight against climate change with its climate actions exceeding its moral and legal responsibility. Developed countries are progressing at the cost of their developing counterparts, Yadav said and added that India has contributed only around 4% of global cumulative emissions since pre-industrial era.

335.title: India is biggest market for exports from B'desh across Asia: PM
335.article_body: Addressing a joint press briefing with his Bangladeshi counterpart Sheikh Hasina, PM Narendra Modi said, "Across Asia, India is the biggest market for exports from Bangladesh." "To further expedite this progress, we will soon initiate discussions on a bilateral economic comprehensive partnership agreement," PM Modi added. Notably, Bangladesh PM Hasina began her four-day visit to India on Monday.

336.title: Solomon Islands calls Aus' offer to fund election 'inappropriate'
336.article_body: The Solomon Islands government said it appreciates Australia's offer to fund next election but the timing is "inappropriate". Australia extended the offer after the Solomon Island's PM Manasseh Sogavare said that authorities cannot fund the Pacific Games and an election in the same year. "This is an assault on our parliamentary democracy," the Solomon Islands government said in a statement.

337.title: DreamFolks Services records Q1 profit at ₹13.4 cr, revenue up 545%
337.article_body: Airport service aggregator DreamFolks Services recorded consolidated net profit for the June quarter at ₹13.43 crore, compared to a loss of ₹1.38 crore in the corresponding period last year. The total revenue surged to ₹160.46 crore, which is a 545.47% jump from last year. The company got listed on the BSE and NSE at a premium of 56% on Tuesday.

338.title: Pressure is on India, this could also be Pakistan's year in Asia Cup: Sehwag
338.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka, Virender Sehwag said, "If India lose another match, they'll be out of...Asia Cup." He added, "Pakistan have the advantage because if they lose one match and win another, their net run rate will take them to the final...pressure is on India...This could also be Pakistan's year."

339.title: Over 30 Telangana students fall ill, allege dead lizard found in food
339.article_body: Over 30 students of a government-run girls' hostel in Telangana's Warangal fell ill after having dinner. Reports said that one of the students alleged that she saw a dead lizard in the food but that the catering staff said it was a green chilli. Students reportedly started vomiting soon after. Officials said that they have ordered an inquiry.

340.title: Hungary to create anti-graft body in an attempt to unlock EU funds
340.article_body: To oversee the spending of European Union funds, Hungary will create an anti-corruption authority and a working group involving non-government organisations. The move is aimed at unlocking funds as the Hungarian government is facing a stand-off with Brussels over corruption, migration and other issues. Hungary has been awaiting European Commission's approval to draw on money to lift its economy.

341.title: Narayana Hrudayalaya stock rises to 4-month high amid acquisition plan
341.article_body: A day after Narayana Hrudayalaya announced plans to acquire a 100-bed orthopaedic and trauma hospital at Bengaluru's Narayana Health City campus for ₹200 crore, the shares of the hospital chain surged more than 5% to a four-month high of ₹744 apiece on Tuesday. The shares of the Bengaluru-based company were trading at ₹720 apiece at 3:07 pm.

342.title: Fawad Khan, former cricketer Wasim Akram to star in 'MBG'
342.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan is all set to share screen space with former cricketer Wasim Akram in a film titled 'Money Back Guarantee' (MBG). The actor took to Instagram on Tuesday to announce the project. Fawad, who was recently seen in 'Ms. Marvel', has also worked in several Bollywood films, including 'Kapoor & Sons', 'Khoobsurat' and 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil'.

343.title: CPI leader D Raja praises Nitish Kumar, says time to fight unitedly
343.article_body: CPI Leader D Raja hailed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for breaking ties with BJP and for trying to unite the Opposition for 2024 Lok Sabha polls. “Time has come that all secular democratic parties, Left parties, and regional parties must come together and fight unitedly to defeat BJP in the interest of the country and its future,” said Raja.

344.title: Hindu right-wing groups involved in terrorist activities: Ex-RSS worker
344.article_body: A former Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker has alleged that Hindu right-wing groups such as RSS, Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal are engaged in terrorist activities for BJP's political gain. He has also moved an application before the Nanded court, claiming that a VHP leader was directly involved in the Nanded blast case.

345.title: Video shows 3 kids sitting in moving car's boot in Hyd; police take action
345.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video showing three children, including a girl, sitting in the boot of a moving car in Hyderabad and tagged the concerned authorities. The kids were playing with a toy, while adults accompanying them were sitting on the seats. After seeing the video, the Cyberabad Traffic Police verified it and issued a challan.

346.title: Rich nations pledge $25 bn to help Africa adapt to climate change
346.article_body: Rich countries will provide $25 billion to Africa by 2025 to help the continent adapt to climate change, according to officials at a climate summit. President of the African Development Bank, Akinwumi A Adesina, told DW News that Africa is distressed by climate change. "Africa will need $1.3-$1.6 trillion this decade to implement climate goals" Adesina said at the summit.

347.title: Kohli shares 'Notice people' quote amid controversy over 'No one messaged me' remark
347.article_body: Amid controversy over his remark that none of his former teammates barring MS Dhoni messaged him after he quit Test captaincy, Virat Kohli shared a quote on Instagram. The quote read, "Notice the people who are happy for your happiness, and sad for your sadness. They're the ones who deserve special places in your heart." "Word," Kohli captioned the post.

348.title: Google advises users to update Chrome browser to avoid hacking risk
348.article_body: Google has advised its users to quickly install a security update in its Chrome browser to safeguard themselves against a bug being actively exploited by hackers. We're aware that an exploit for 'CVE-2022-3075' exists in the wild, Google added. "Access to bug details and links may be kept restricted until majority of users are updated with a fix," Google said.

349.title: Modernise all govt schools in one go, take states on board: Kejriwal to PM
349.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday urged PM Modi to modernise all government schools across the country instead of doing it in instalments. Kejriwal also urged Centre to take state governments on board in formulating a plan for the same.
