His comments came after PM Modi announced PM-SHRI Yojana to develop 14,500 schools as model schools, equipped with modern infrastructure.

350.title: No non-teaching duties for teachers: Maharashtra CM Shinde
350.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that no non-teaching duties, except for work which is of national importance, will be assigned to teachers in the state. "I have been receiving a number of complaints and applications regarding non-educational work being assigned to teachers," he added. "Instructions regarding the same will be given to the department," Shinde further said.

351.title: Call 112 or tag us on Twitter to report unmanned barricades: Delhi Police
351.article_body: The Delhi Police on Monday told the High Court that people can either dial 112 or tweet tagging the Delhi Traffic Police (@dtptraffic) and Delhi Police (@delhipoliceon) to report any unmanned barricades on the roads in the national capital. Police informed the court that no barricades on roads would be left unattended and ensured immediate action on such complaints.

352.title: 11 persons cheated of ₹2 cr in investment fraud in Mumbai, 1 held
352.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a software engineer, 34-year-old Kishan Katnhar, and booked two others for allegedly cheating 11 investors of over ₹2 crore on the pretext of giving huge returns on their investment. According to the complainant, 28-year-old Mohammed Irfan Khan, along with his family members invested over ₹92 lakh with the accused between November 2016 to December 2017.

353.title: Iran demands closure of IAEA probe for revival of 2015 nuclear deal
353.article_body: Tehran wants the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to drop its probe against Iran's nuclear activities as a guarantee for the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, the Iranian foreign ministry said on Monday. The US has already rejected linking the IAEA probe with the pact. Uranium traces found at three undeclared Iranian nuclear sites had triggered the probe.

354.title: Stock up supplies, prepare bomb shelters: Ukraine to Crimea residents
354.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have asked residents of Russia-annexed Crimea to prepare bomb shelters and stock up supplies like water and charge power banks. The announcement comes as Kyiv prepares to launch a counteroffensive against Russian troops to drive them out of the Ukrainian territory. Russia annexed Crimea in 2014, however, the territory is still internationally recognised as a part of Ukraine.

355.title: DNA proof submitted against former inspector accused of rape in Hyd
355.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Monday submitted DNA evidence in a Hyderabad court against former Marredpally inspector K Nageswara Rao, who is accused of raping a woman. Opposing Rao's second bail petition, Additional Public Prosecutor Ganga Reddy said that the DNA report shows that Rao committed the crime. Rao allegedly raped a woman whose husband he had arrested in the past.

356.title: India-B'desh relations role model for neighbourhood diplomacy: B'desh PM
356.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina, who is on a four-day visit to India, said on Tuesday that India's bilateral relations with Bangladesh are a role model for neighbourhood diplomacy. "I appreciate Modi ji's visionary leadership that continues to provide added momentum to our bilateral relations," she said, adding that India is Bangladesh's most important neighbour.

357.title: Bharat Biotech's nasal COVID vaccine gets emergency use authorisation in 18+ age group
357.article_body: Bharat Biotech's ChAd36-SARS-CoV-S COVID-19 (Chimpanzee Adenovirus Vectored) recombinant nasal vaccine has been approved by the CDSCO for primary immunisation against COVID-19 in 18+ age group for restricted use in emergency situation. It is India's first nasal vaccine for COVID-19. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted, "Big boost to India's fight against COVID-19!"

358.title: TikTok denies breach after hacker group claims 2 billion users' data stolen
358.article_body: TikTok has denied claims of any data breach after a hacking forum said it had accessed the data of over 2 billion users. The hacker forum had claimed that it had accessed 790GB worth of user data, platform statistics, code, and more. A TikTok spokesperson asserted that its team "found no evidence of a security breach".

359.title: Web series on Rajiv Gandhi's assassination in the works
359.article_body: A web series based on former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination is in the works. Titled 'Trail of an Assassin', it'll be made using inputs from 'Ninety Days: The True Story of the Hunt for Rajiv Gandhi's Assassins', a recently launched book written by Anirudhya Mitra. Nagesh Kukunoor, known for directing films like 'Iqbal' and 'Dor', will helm the upcoming project.

360.title: Brendan Fraser supported me kicking off my H'wood career: Dwayne Johnson
360.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson took to Twitter and shared a video of Brendan Fraser receiving a standing ovation for his film 'The Whale'. Along with the video, Dwayne wrote he is "happy" to see Brendan receive a "beautiful ovation". "He supported me coming into his 'Mummy Returns' franchise for my first ever role, which kicked off my Hollywood career," Dwayne revealed.

361.title: Rahul Gandhi is 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu': MP Home Minister
361.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is an 'Ichhadhari chunavi Hindu' who visits temples when elections are near. He said that the people of Gujarat know well that Gandhi makes false poll promises. Gandhi had made the false promise of waiving farmers' loans up to ₹2 lakh in MP as well, Mishra added.

362.title: I don't even desire PM candidature: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
362.article_body: Reacting to the speculations about his PM candidature for the 2024 general elections, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "I'm not even...claimant, I don't even desire it." It's time for the Left parties, Congress and all regional parties to come together to form a united Opposition against the BJP, he said. Kumar's remarks came after he met CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury.

363.title: 'Stressed on cooperation against terrorism', says PM Modi at presser with Bangladesh PM
363.article_body: Addressing a press conference with Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said, "Today we also stressed on cooperation against terrorism and fundamentalism." He also said, "To keep the spirit of 1971 alive, it is very necessary that we face such forces together, who want to attack our mutual trust." Notably, India and Bangladesh signed seven MoUs today.

364.title: Do I look illiterate to you?: Maharashtra minister on being trolled for his remark
364.article_body: Maharashtra Public Health Minister Tanaji Sawant, who is being trolled for allegedly mistaking Haffkine Institute for Training, Research and Testing for a person named Haffkine, criticised the media. "[Media] isn't happy that this government is being formed...Do I look like an illiterate minister to you all?" Sawant asked. He asked for proof where he said that Haffkine is a person.

365.title: Elon Musk says 90% of comments on his tweets are bots, shares screenshot
365.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted a screenshot of some comments on one of his tweets, apparently by a fake account of Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao, and wrote, "90% of my comments are bots." Musk has accused Twitter of lying about the number of bots on the platform. He's currently seeking to terminate the $44 billion merger agreement signed with Twitter.

366.title: Remote-controlled cyborg cockroach fitted with solar cell created; video released
366.article_body: Japanese scientists have created a remote-controlled cyborg cockroach that can be used to inspect dangerous areas and monitor the environment. They developed a system using an ultrasoft solar cell that doesn't hinder the cockroach's movement. The system is wired into the cockroach's nervous system and pressing a button sends a shock, tricking it into moving in a certain direction.

367.title: It's childlike atmosphere on sets: Sudhanshu on rift reports with Rupali
367.article_body: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey opened up about reports stating he has a rift with 'Anupamaa' co-star Rupali Ganguly. "My reaction is, 'Why don't you come to the sets and watch?' Simple as that," he stated. "It's absolute fun all the time. We are...running around, poking fun at each other, cracking jokes. It's a very childlike atmosphere on the sets," he added.

368.title: Thank you for giving us many moments to say 'Raina hai na': Amit Mishra
368.article_body: Reacting to ex-India batter Suresh Raina announcing his retirement from all formats of cricket, Amit Mishra tweeted, "Every cricket and IPL fan will remember you for your timely knocks which you played for the country and CSK." Mishra added, "Wish you a great retirement life ahead. Thank you for giving us many moments to say, 'Raina hai na'."

369.title: This combination isn't working: Pujara on India's playing XI in Asia Cup
369.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara said that the current playing XI combination isn't working in the Asia Cup and Axar Patel should come in along with an extra seamer into the lineup. "Hardik has been bowling well, but we can't consider him a fifth bowler. I think expecting four overs from him every time is not correct," he added.

370.title: Mumbai Police arrest 7 for providing fake documents to criminals for bail
370.article_body: Mumbai Police have busted a racket where people were involved in producing fake documents to furnish bail for the undertrials in jail for serious offences. Seven people, including three women, in connection with the racket have been arrested. All female accused are homemakers, police said. Notably, the accused have submitted forged documents in Ulhasnagar, Kalyan, Nashik and Panvel courts.

371.title: KL Rahul, Athiya Shetty to marry at Suniel Shetty's Khandala bungalow: Report
371.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul and actress Athiya Shetty will marry at Suniel Shetty's bungalow Jahaan in Khandala, said reports. The date will be fixed keeping in mind the cricketer's work schedule and a wedding organiser has visited Khandala to do recce, reports added. Reacting to wedding rumours, Suniel earlier said, "The wedding will take place as soon as the kids decide."

372.title: I’m a booster rocket that fulfilled its function: Outgoing UK PM Johnson
372.article_body: In his last address as UK PM, Boris Johnson said he's "now like one of those booster rockets that has fulfilled its function". "I'll...be gently re-entering the atmosphere and splashing down invisibly in some remote and obscure corner of the Pacific," he added. Liz Truss was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after defeating Indian-origin Rishi Sunak.

373.title: My face isn't good enough to be on a film's poster: Darlings actor Vijay
373.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who featured in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Darlings', said his face is "not good enough" for a film's poster, during a recent event where he was being roasted. "But in scenes, this face becomes unforgettable. All these f****rs say...I'm not a star...That's strange because they cast me in...films to get that extra star in...reviews. I'm that star," he added.

374.title: No vacancy for PM post: RS Prasad after Nitish Kumar meets Rahul Gandhi
374.article_body: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met Congress' Rahul Gandhi, BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Had Nitish Kumar been proactive in developing Bihar like he is for his personal ambition, many Bihari youth would have got employment opportunity." "There's no vacancy for the PM post and many Opposition leaders are already standing in the queue. You too stand," Prasad added.

375.title: First-class passengers in Mumbai can upgrade passes to travel in AC locals: CR
375.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) announced that first-class local train passengers can travel in AC local trains by upgrading their quarterly passes. The pass holders need to pay the difference amount in fare while upgrading the ticket. The difference will be calculated for the period from when the upgrade was made till the date of expiry, the Railway officials said.

376.title: BSF foil smuggling bid, recover heroin worth ₹22.65 cr in Punjab
376.article_body: After reportedly foiling a smuggling attempt by Pakistan-based smugglers, troops of the Border Security Force (BSF) have recovered heroin worth ₹22.65 crore from a village in Punjab's Abohar. The seizure was done after BSF troops conducted a search operation based on specific inputs. In August, the BSF had recovered a cache of assault weapons along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab.

377.title: Man held with 116 grams gold in specially made undergarments at Hyd airport
377.article_body: Customs officials have arrested a passenger who was smuggling gold at the Hyderabad Airport and have seized 116 grams of gold valued at ₹6 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle gold in specially made undergarments. The customs officials did a body scan after being suspicious. A case has been registered against the passenger, reports said.

378.title: Ambulance leaves pregnant woman on UP road for failing to pay ₹1,000
378.article_body: An ambulance left a pregnant woman on the road in UP as the woman's family did not have enough money to pay them. In a video, the pregnant woman can be seen sitting on the road while her family tries to help her. The ambulance driver left her on the road as the family failed to pay ₹1,000, reports said.

379.title: Multiple cases of theft reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal
379.article_body: Multiple cases of theft of cash and phones have been reported at Pune's Dagdusheth Ganpati pandal. Two FIRs, one by a woman reporting the theft of her mobile phone worth ₹44,000 and the other by a man reporting theft of ₹2,000 from his pocket, were filed on Sunday. Another complainant stated his mobile worth ₹19,491 was stolen on August 31.

380.title: Economist Bibek Debroy appointed Chancellor of Pune's Deccan College
380.article_body: Economist Bibek Debroy has been appointed as the Chancellor of Deccan College Post Graduate and Research Institute, Pune. He will succeed archaeologist AP Jamkhedkar. Debroy is presently the Chairman of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister. He has authored several books and also translated Sanskrit works on Indian mythological books.

381.title: Groom flees wedding reception after his first wife brings police to venue in Hyd
381.article_body: A man fled the reception party of his wedding with his second wife after his first wife reached the venue with police officers in Hyderabad. Syed Nazeer reportedly didn't inform his first wife Dr Sana Samreen about his second marriage. He allegedly sought money from her and started keeping away from her when her family couldn't pay the sum.

382.title: World no. 1 Swiatek enters her maiden quarter-final at US Open
382.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek advanced to her first US Open quarter-final after a 2-6, 6-4, 6-0 win over unseeded Jule Niemeier in fourth round. This is Swiatek's third Grand Slam quarter-final of 2022. The top seed won the match in two hours 23 minutes. Eighth seed Jessie Pegula beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-3, 6-2 in fourth round.

383.title: Oppn parties have to save country, Constitution together: CPI(M) leader
383.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday said that Opposition parties have to save the country and the Constitution together. His statement came after meeting Bihar CM Nitish Kumar in Delhi. CM Kumar said, "We have discussed that if the Left parties, regional parties in different states and Congress come together then it will be a big deal."

384.title: 313 applications get double COVID compensation in Pune: Officials
384.article_body: A total of 313 COVID-19 compensation applications have received double compensation from the Pune district, officials said. District Disaster Management officer Vitthal Banote said, "These double compensations have been due to banks depositing double amounts." Maharashtra government has declared an ex-gratia of ₹50,000 for the kin of those who lost their lives due to COVID-19 in the state.

385.title: Traffic restrictions in parts of Delhi for Central Vista inauguration on Sept 8
385.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police announced large-scale traffic diversions and restrictions on the roads leading to the C-Hexagon in India Gate and adjoining areas on Thursday (September 8) as PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to inaugurate Central Vista Avenue. Several roads will be closed for general traffic from 6 pm to 9 pm on Thursday for VVIPs' security, the police said.

386.title: Class 11 TN girl who threw baby gave birth in school toilet, cut umbilical cord with pen
386.article_body: The 16-year-old Class 11 girl, who allegedly threw her newborn baby in bushes in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district, gave birth alone in her school's toilet, police said. "The girl allegedly cut the umbilical cord herself using a pen and came back to the classroom," an official said. The baby's body was found by another student.

387.title: Ability only for changing names of roads: RJD MP over renaming Rajpath
387.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha reacted to Centre's announcement that Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. "What to say when there's silence on people-oriented concerns...ability is only to change roads' names?" Jha tweeted. "Today's biggest challenges like unemployment...if it has positive effect then everything is acceptable," Jha added.

388.title: India, Bangladesh sign 7 MoUs in presence of PM Modi, Sheikh Hasina
388.article_body: India and Bangladesh on Tuesday signed seven MoUs in presence of PM Narendra Modi and Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina. MoUs were signed in many sectors including water sharing, flood mitigation, defence and others. "Today, we've signed an important agreement regarding water-sharing of Kushiyara River," PM Modi said. "We've decided to extend cooperation in IT, space and nuclear sectors," he added.

389.title: This isn't a new thing for me: Amitabh Bachchan on having 5 releases in 2022
389.article_body: On being asked about having five releases in 2022, actor Amitabh Bachchan said that this is not a new thing for him. "We had multiple releases in a month back in the day. I have had 7-8 films released in a year," he added. He starred in 'Jhund' and 'Runway 34' and will be seen in 'Brahmāstra', 'Goodbye' and 'Uunchai'.

390.title: Shopee rescinded dozens of job offers in last 2 weeks: Report
390.article_body: E-commerce firm Shopee has rescinded dozens of job offers in the past two weeks after its parent firm Sea reported rising losses and slower revenue growth, Reuters reported. Shopee withdrew the offers days before the people were due to begin work. "Due to adjustments to hiring plans...a number of roles at Shopee are no longer available," a Shopee representative said.

391.title: PM Modi to visit Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday
391.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit the Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh on his birthday on September 17. "On...same day, Cheetahs from South Africa will be brought to the park," said Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Notably, the BJP will celebrate PM Modi's birthday from September 17 for a period of 16 days as "Seva Pakhwara" (service fortnight).

392.title: Met Muhammad Ali for a film, ended up getting a punch: Big B
392.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled his meeting with American boxer Muhammad Ali at the latter's Beverly Hills residence in Los Angeles. The actor said, "Producer-director Prakash Mehra ji wanted to make a film with Muhammad Ali and me...That film never got made but I ended up getting a punch." He further called the boxer "a wonderful human being".

393.title: Neither ruled myself in nor out: Tharoor on Cong President post
393.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he has neither ruled himself in nor out of the election to the President's post to the party. "I hope many will contest in order to give the membership a wide choice," he said. The leadership vacuum at the top has had a damaging effect within the party, he added.

394.title: Senior citizen on morning walk robbed, attacked with sharp weapon in Pune
394.article_body: A senior citizen was reportedly robbed of his phone and attacked with a sharp weapon by three men in Pune's Kharadi on Thursday. According to police, Babam Dahifale, 60, was on a morning walk when three persons on a motorcycle tried to snatch his cell phone. As Dahifale resisted, one of the accused attacked him, injuring his leg and abdomen.

395.title: Actors possibly work the least while making a film: Rakul Preet Singh
395.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that actors "possibly work the least" while making a film. Rakul further stated that assistant directors to light-men work for "14-15 hours" a day during filmmaking. She added, "It's just for them that you want to go and watch the film in a theatre." The actress recently featured in 'Cuttputlli' and 'Runway 34'.

396.title: Lucknow hotel had iron grills on windows, no one could escape during fire: FIR
396.article_body: Lucknow's Hotel Levana, where a fire had broken out on Monday, had iron grills on windows, FIR registered in the case said. The FIR reportedly added that due to the iron grills, no one could come out from the window during the fire incident and that the fire brigade had difficulty breaking windows.

397.title: 'Thiruchitrambalam' earns ₹100cr, becomes Dhanush's highest earner
397.article_body: Dhanush-starrer Tamil film 'Thiruchitrambalam' has collected over ₹100 crore at the worldwide box office, becoming the highest earning film of the actor's career. The film, which also stars Nithya Menen, Raashii Khanna, Prakash Raj, Bharathiraja and Priya Bhavani Shankar, features Dhanush in the role of a food delivery boy. The actor was last seen in Hollywood film 'The Gray Man'.

398.title: Minority is not allowed errors: Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt support Arshdeep
398.article_body: Celebrities Varun Grover, Pooja Bhatt and Angad Bedi supported cricketer Arshdeep Singh after he was trolled over his dropped catch in India-Pakistan Asia Cup match. Varun tweeted in Hindi, "Minority is not allowed to make human errors. They should always remain perfect. Majority will take care of imperfections." Pooja wrote, "Society cannot cannibalise success and conveniently discard failures."

399.title: J'khand Congress chief calls BJP 'bachcha chor' after trust vote
399.article_body: A day after Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren won the trust vote, state Congress chief Rajesh Thakur on Tuesday called the BJP 'bachcha chor' or thieves of children. "Our MLAs were not going anywhere. BJP destabilises the country's non-BJP state governments and we always take precautions because they are like 'bachcha chor'," said Thakur.

400.title: Hyd to get 23-km long solar roof cycle track by 2023, KTR shares video
400.article_body: Hyderabad will have a 23-km long cycle track with a solar roof by 2023, Telangana Minister of Municipal Administration and Urban Development, KT Rama Rao, announced on Twitter. While sharing a video, he said that he will be laying the foundation of the project on Tuesday. "Plan to deliver it before summer 2023," he wrote.

401.title: It will always remain special to me: Omung Kumar on 8 years of 'Mary Kom'
401.article_body: Filmmaker Omung Kumar on Monday took to Instagram to share a series of still and behind-the-scenes pictures to mark eight years since the release of 'Mary Kom'. He wrote alongside the pictures, "My first directorial film 'MARY KOM'. Thank you to everyone who made this possible." The Priyanka Chopra-starrer is a biographical sports film based on boxer Mary Kom.

402.title: I think India might bring in another finisher vs Sri Lanka: Sehwag
402.article_body: Ahead of India's Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Sri Lanka today, Virender Sehwag said India might include wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in the playing XI. "If you have brought in Karthik at the age of 37...then he should play till the World Cup," stated Sehwag. Karthik played in India's first two games in the Asia Cup.
